events.description: Venture into the Catalan countryside to visit Montserrat and go wine tasting on this full-day tour from Barcelona. Take a guided tour through the Basilica and Monastery on Montserrat, a beautiful, multi-peak mountain with dramatic rock formations, with free time to continue exploring the museum, farmer's market, or views from the ridge of Cavall Bernat. Afterward, visit the winery of Oller de Mas for a cellar tour, wine tasting, and a multi-course, Catalan meal.
events.name: Montserrat Tour from Barcelona Including Lunch and Gourmet Wine Tasting

events.description: The long lines attracted by La Sagrada Familia and Park Guell, two of Antoni Gaudi’s modernist masterpieces, are a testament to their global renown. Spend less time lining up and more time sightseeing with skip-the-line entry to both the cathedral and park on a guided tour. Visit Park Guell before using private transportation to reach La Sagrada Familia where you can feast your eyes on the spectacular interior and exterior. Small-group tour limited to 12 people.
events.name: Skip the Line: Park Guell and La Sagrada Familia Guided Tour

events.description: Sail past long lines of tourists trying to gain entry to Gaudi’s La Sagrada Familia with this priority access tour of the modernist masterpiece. Accompanied by a guide, head straight inside to get fascinating insight into the history of the UNESCO World Heritage-listed cathedral. Admire the opulent ceilings and stained-glass windows while learning about the building’s charismatic creator. Visit the museum to see exhibits on the cathedral’s history and observe original plaster models and design sketches.
events.name: Fast Track Sagrada Familia Guided Tour

events.description: This tour is a great choice for travelers interested in historic sites. Save time waiting in long visitor lines with a skip-the-line entrance ticket to the stunning complex of Alhambra included. Explore the palace complex and Generalife with a guide, so you don’t get lost. Your guide enhances your day with stories about the history, art, culture, and mysteries of the palace and surrounding area.
events.name: Skip-the-Line Alhambra and Generalife Guided Tour

events.description: Discover three countries in just one day on a full-day tour to Baga, Ax Les Thermes, and Andorra from Barcelona. Emerge early, and head to Baga, a beautiful village shrouded in medieval heritage, and then cross the border to Ax Les Therms, a charming spa town with loads of French character. Continue to Andorra via a stunning high mountain pass, stopping for a break in a beautiful mountain valley before going on to the capital to indulge in some duty-free shopping. Receive personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour, limited to only 20 people.
events.name: The Original Three Countries in One Day: France, Andorra, Spain from Barcelona

events.description: Explore one of the cornerstones of Catalan culture and history on this small-group tour to Montserrat. See the Montserrat Monastery, home to the famous Black Madonna, and then follow a guide through the vineyards of Oller del Mas, a winery housed in a 10th-century castle. Descend into the cellars to learn about the production methods, and sample three signature wines alongside a cold tapas lunch with dessert.
events.name: Montserrat Half-Day Tour with Tapas and Gourmet Wines from Barcelona

events.description: Visit Granada’s Alhambra Palace on this full-day coach trip from Seville. Skip the line at the UNESCO-listed fortress wedged between Granada and the Sierra Nevada mountains, and take a guided tour of its attractions, including the Nasrid Palace, Alcazabar and Generalife Gardens. See the Moorish salons, courtyards and pavilions, learn about their history and break to purchase lunch in central Granada. Upgrade to finish with a walking tour of Albaicin, the city’s whitewashed Moorish quarter, with its narrow streets, flower-filled squares and spectacular Alhambra views.
events.name: Granada Day Trip from Seville Including Skip-the-Line Entrance to Alhambra Palace and Optional Albaicin Walking Tour

events.description: Immerse yourself in the medieval majesty of Toledo, a UNESCO-listed site replete with historical monuments and Segovia on a full-day tour from Madrid. With a knowledgeable guide, witness the arresting landmarks of each city while discovering fascinating historical facts. Admire the grand cathedral and sacred monastery of San Juan in Toledo, marvel at the ancient aqueduct and regal Alcazar in Segovia, and gain valuable insight into the history and culture of each city from your expert guide. Enjoy the convenience of comfortable round-trip transportation on this tour.
events.name: Toledo and Segovia Tour with Alcazar Entrance from Madrid

events.description: Marvel over Montserrat, and then enjoy tapas and wine on this full-day, small-group tour from Barcelona. Ride the cogwheel train to the mountaintop monastery of Montserrat, admire views over the Catalan countryside, and sample local treats such as coca de Montserrat and Montserrat liquor. Next, head to the Oller del Mas château, where you can tour the wine cellar, stroll the vineyards, and indulge in an expert-led winetasting. Finally, choose to dig into a delicious tapas brunch at the château, or enjoy a 3-course meal at a local restaurant.
events.name: Montserrat with Cogwheel train, Tasting in a Boutique Winery with Tapas or Lunch

events.description: Delve into the cultural tapestry of Toledo, a treasure trove of El Greco artworks and ancient fortifications, on a tour from Madrid. Accompanied by a guide, navigate the cobbled streets, and explore the diverse architecture of the medieval city. Admire masterpieces by El Greco as you go on a morning, afternoon, or full-day excursion.
events.name: Toledo Half-Day or Full-Day Tour from Madrid

events.description: Discover the best of Barcelona on this convenient City Sightseeing hop-on hop-off tour. Choose from a 1- or 2-day pass, relax on the open-top, double-decker bus, and enjoy your own sightseeing itinerary as you travel the three routes (two during the winter) and learn about the landmarks via the onboard commentary. Stay aboard to enjoy 360-degree views of the sights, and hop on and off at any of the 44 stops at leisure to explore top Barcelona attractions such as La Sagrada Familia, the medieval Gothic Quarter, the colorful Las Ramblas and more.
events.name: City Sightseeing Barcelona Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour

events.description: Visit the home of the Real Madrid football club Santiago Bernabeu Stadium, with a convenient and time-saving admission ticket. Buy your direct-entry ticket in advance and feed your love of football at the on-site museum, where you’ll learn about the stadium’s history. Explore virtually all areas of the arena, including the tunnel to the changing rooms, the trophy room, and presidential box and enjoy a snack at the stadium café.
events.name: Direct Entry Ticket to Bernabeu Stadium

events.description: Visit two Barcelona must-sees in one day without any rushing for trains or buses, and with a guide to provide background and stories on each site and wider Catalonia on this full-day, small-group tour. Beat the lines at the Sagrada Familia to admire Gaudi’s mastery, and after a stroll around Barcelona’s Gothic Quarter, be transported to Montserrat to explore the mountainside monastery. If you wish, upgrade to a private tour.
events.name: Barcelona Sagrada Familia and Montserrat Small Group Tour with Hotel pick-up

events.description: Explore Nasrid Palaces, the Alhambra, and Generalife Gardens at your own pace on this audio-guided tour. Learn about Moorish history and the Nasrid Kingdom, the last Muslim dynasty on the Iberian Peninsula. Visit the Alhambra fortress, tour the royal palaces, and stroll the lush grounds of Generalife Gardens, a place of leisure for Granda’s rulers.
events.name: Alhambra: Nasrid Palaces & Generalife Ticket with Audioguide

events.description: Tuck into tasty tapas and traditional wines on this 3-hour gastronomic tour of Barcelona. Get the inside scoop on Barcelona’s renowned foodie scene from a local guide and stop along the way to dine at four of the city’s best tapas bars. At each restaurant, sample an array of delicious Catalan cuisine, taste local specialties like Iberian ham, ‘’ or ‘pan con tomate’ (spicy potatoes, bread and tomato), and choose from a selection of fine regional wines. You can choose between an afternoon or evening tour.
events.name: Tapas and Wine Experience Small-Group Walking Tour

events.description: Delve into the architectural beauty and rich history of Barcelona on a comprehensive full- or half-day tour of the Catalonian capital. With an expert guide, visit some of the city’s most iconic sights and enjoy skip-the-line access to Gaudi’s modernist masterpiece, La Sagrada Familia. Ascend to Montjuïc Hill to enjoy sweeping vistas of Barcelona’s metropolitan sprawl and stroll the streets of the Gothic Quarter on a guided tour. Receive personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour.
events.name: Priority Access: Best of Barcelona Tour Including Sagrada Familia

events.description: Discover Madrid’s vibrant culinary scene on a 3-hour tapas tour. Stroll through the evening-lit streets with a guide and sample up to 10 delicious tapas dishes at four popular restaurants while learning about the local ingredients. Treat your palette to delicious Spanish wines complemented by Iberian ham, salted cod, rich chickpea stew and more. To keep this experience intimate, group size is limited to 12 people.
events.name: Madrid Tapas and Wine Tasting Tour

events.description: Discover the spectacular sights and cultural delights of Barcelona on a 1- or 2-day hop-on hop-off bus tour. From the open-top deck of a distinctive double-decker bus, see the impressive monuments of the Catalonian capital and disembark whenever an attraction captures your attention. Explore both the East and West route to admire the medieval charm of Las Ramblas and see the sandy stretch of Port Olimpic. Marvel at the architectural magnificence of Gaudi buildings and feel awe-inspired by the famous F.C. Barcelona football stadium.
events.name: Barcelona City Tour Hop-On Hop-Off

events.description: Make the most of your visit to Barcelona's architectural crown jewel on a skip-the-line tour of the Sagrada Familia Cathedral. Bypass the long wait to enter Gaudí’s Modernist masterpiece, and learn about the inspiration and symbolism of the cathedral’s design on a guided tour of all five levels. Finally, ascend the cathedral towers to rise directly over the heart of Barcelona for panoramic city views.
events.name: Sagrada Familia: Fast Track Guided Tour with Tower Access

events.description: Discover medieval Girona and the Dali Museum in Figueres, where the artist Salvador Dalí was born, on this day trip from Barcelona by air-conditioned coach. With a guide, take a walking tour of Girona’s picturesque Old Town. Learn about the city’s wealth during the Middle Ages and admire the Cathedral and colorful houses huddled along the Onyar River. After free time for lunch, travel to the Dali Museum in Figueres. View the flamboyant, egg-topped exterior of the Dali Theatre-Museum and explore its collection of paintings, sculptures and jewelry.
events.name: Girona, Figueres and Dali Museum Day Trip from Barcelona

events.description: Make a pilgrimage to Santa Maria de Montserrat, a monastery near Barcelona and one of Spain's key religious sites, during this visit. Join your guide as you scale Montserrat Mountain on the cogwheel train, enjoying striking vistas of the mountain's surreal rock formations and Barcelona off in the distance. Then visit Benedictine Santa Maria de Montserrat abbey and the Royal Basilica of Montserrat, where you'll view La Moreneta (the Dark One) a 12th-century carving of Our Lady of Montserrat, and sample three local liquors at the on-site gift shop. This Montserrat visit also includes entrance fees and transport by air-conditioned coach.
events.name: Montserrat Monastery Afternoon Tour with Cog-wheel Train

events.description: Gaudi’s magnificent La Sagrada Familia is the undisputed symbol of Barcelona. Enhance your experience of this architectural icon during a tour of the cathedral with access the towers. Alongside your guide, you’ll gain an appreciation for the finer details of the UNESCO-listed landmark’s interior and learn about the inspiration and construction of La Sagrada Familia. Finish the tour ascending to the top of one of the towers, a unique experience offering panoramic views of Barcelona’s cityscape and coast.
events.name: Sagrada Familia Guided Tour with Towers Access

events.description: On this compact walking tour, experience some of Seville's historic highlights without wasting your whole day on a tour bus. Visit two of the city's three UNESCO World Heritage Sites, the Royal Alcázar of Seville and the Cathedral of Seville, and explore them without waiting in line - entrance fees are covered by your tour costs. Learn about the city's rich history, from its royal heritage to the lives of its average citizens, from your small group's guide.
events.name: Cathedral & Alcazar of Seville Guided Tour (Skip the Line)

events.description: Leave Barcelona behind, and head for the medieval city of Girona and the scenic Costa Brava. This day tour through the Catalonian villages of northeastern Spain includes guided tours of Pals and Calella de Palafrugell. Take in the breathtaking Mediterranean Sea from viewpoints along the way, including the coastal coves and cliffs of the Camino de Ronda. Enjoy the intimacy of travel with a small group. Hotel pickup and drop-off are included.
events.name: Girona and Costa Brava Small-Group Tour with Hotel pickup from Barcelona

events.description: Experience two UNESCO World Heritage Site cities in one day on this tour to Toledo and Segovia. See Segovia’s narrow streets and preserved Roman aqueduct. Uncover ancient mysteries during a guided tour of the ancient fortress, the Alcázar. In Toledo, the city of three cultures, discover the architecture and history of Muslim, Jewish, and Christian societies who once lived here and take a guided tour of the Cathedral of Toledo.
events.name: Segovia and Toledo with Alcazar and Optional Cathedral Access

events.description: Visit Segovia, Ávila, and Toledo—three cities that are UNESCO World Heritage Sites—on a full-day tour from Madrid that features ancient battlements, a soaring cathedral, a historic monastery, and more. Coordinated tours and transport make the most of your travel time so you can cover more ground without rushing to catch trains or find buses; traveling with a guide takes you straight to the three cities’ essential sights.
events.name: Three Cities in One Day: Segovia, Ávila & Toledo from Madrid

events.description: A hop-on hop-off Madrid sightseeing tour by open-top double-decker bus is the perfect introduction to this incredible city. Select a 1- or 2-day ticket that lets you board and disembark at any of the 37 stops along two interconnecting routes, so you can explore city sights at your own pace. Hear onboard audio commentary and check out Madrid’s many plazas, museums and theaters with the provided map and guidebook.
events.name: Madrid City Tour Hop-On Hop-Off

events.description: Explore the beautiful UNESCO World Heritage Site of Alhambra on 3-hour private tour. Avoid the long lines and head straight into the complex with your tour guide. See the Alcazaba, La Qasba, the Nazaries Palaces, La Dar al-Mamlaka, and Generalife and learn about the rich history behind this Moorish structure. Customize the itinerary to your preferences and admire the beautiful architecture of the citadel.
events.name: Private Official Guide to Visit Alhambra in Granada

events.description: Visit the UNESCO-listed cities of Segovia and Avila on this day trip from Madrid. Travel from Madrid to Avila by air-conditioned coach, and admire the picturebook old town with its stunning 11th century walls. See Avila Cathedral and the Basilica of St Vincent, and then continue to the historical showstopper of Segovia. Behold its massive Roman aqueduct and explore its Gothic cathedral and fairy tale-like Alcazar fortress-palace. Upgrade to include a simple, tourist-style lunch or a gourmet feast of Segovian specialities with drinks to make your Madrid-to-Segovia-and-Avila adventure extra special.
events.name: Avila with Walls and Segovia Day Tour from Madrid with Optional Lunch

events.description: Learn to make Spanish tapas, traditional paella, and sangria with a Barcelona chef, then share a hearty dinner of classic local cuisine that you've made yourself. All great Spanish food starts with super fresh ingredients, and you begin this cooking class with a guided trip through La Boqueria market before heading to a professional teaching kitchen. This hands-on Spanish cooking class includes snacks, drinks, and dinner, and you finish the night with recipes to take back to your home kitchen.
events.name: Interactive Spanish Cooking Experience in Barcelona

events.description: Explore the architectural and cultural treasures of Cordoba on a fascinating full-day tour from Seville. Wander the narrow alleyways of the Jewish Quarter and admire the Moorish magnificence of the architecture. Immerse yourself in the religious resplendence of the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Mosque-Cathedral of Cordoba and see one of Spain’s few existing synagogues. Delve deeper into the Islamic heritage of the city with an interesting guide and enjoy a stress-free sojourn with a priority access pass.
events.name: Cordoba Day Trip from Seville Including Skip-the-Line Ticket to Cordoba Mosque and Optional Tour of Carmona

events.description: Skip the hassle of planning—and the lines along the way—on this private tour of Barcelona’s heritage, architecture, and gastronomy that combines a walking tour with taxi rides to top destinations. Ideal for first-time visitors who want to squeeze all the highlights into one day, traveling with a personal guide lets you maximize your time and discover parts of the city you would likely miss on your own.
events.name: The Most Complete Full Day Private Tour with Sagrada Familia and Park Guell

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/142027P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Alhambra & Nasrid Palaces Private tour

events.description: Make a pilgrimage to the mystical mountaintop retreat of Montserrat during this half-day excursion from Barcelona with a small group. Join no more than eight guests on an exploration of this nearly 1,000-year old Benedictine Monastery complex set high above Catalonia. See the famous ‘Black Madonna’ icon and visit legendary ‘Holy Cave’ where the virgin is said to have once appeared. Finish by enjoying the sublime singing of ‘La Escolania de Montserrat,’ one of the Europe’s oldest children’s choirs. A guide, entrance fee and private transport are included.
events.name: Morning or Afternoon Montserrat Tour with Small Group and Hotel pick-up

events.description: Experience an exhilarating flamenco performance at Barcelona’s legendary Tablao Cordobes. Cheer on a talented troupe of flamenco dancers as a unique display of agility, passion and energy is demonstrated on stage. Take in the lively atmosphere of one of Spain’s most famous flamenco venues and opt to enjoy a traditional Spanish buffet or refreshing drink while watching the show.
events.name: Flamenco Night at Tablao Cordobes

events.description: Sample the fascinating food, scenery, wildlife and medieval history of Andalusia during this 10-hour exploration of Ronda and some of the area’s small villages. Sample olive oil in Zahara de la Sierra, then enjoy the views and scout for vultures at ‘Puerto de las Palomas.’ Cap it all off with a visit to historic Ronda, one of the oldest towns in Spain.
events.name: White Villages and Ronda Day Tour from Seville

events.description: Discover the imperial majesty of Granada’s Alhambra and its gorgeous Generalife Gardens on this walking tour. Sail past long lines at the entrance hall with an exclusive priority access pass, and then embark upon an enriching exploration of the palace complex. See the magnificent Moorish architecture of the Nasrid palaces and a gain a glimpse into the decadent sultans who once inhabited the opulent structure. Admire panoramic city vistas from a hilltop perch; stroll through the botanical beauty of the Generalife Gardens and enjoy convenient round-trip hotel transportation during this exciting excursion.
events.name: Skip the Line: Alhambra and Generalife Gardens Half-Day Tour

events.description: Let yourself be allured by the raw emotion and captivating choreography of a traditional flamenco show at the esteemed Tablao Flamenco El Arenal in Seville. Sink into a comfortable seat in a venue considered one of the best in the world and watch an electrifying performance that expertly demonstrates the flair and fire of Spanish flamenco. Watch a talented troupe of award-winning dancers move to melodious guitar music and enjoy complimentary drinks, traditional tapas or a gourmet 3-course meal.
events.name: Flamenco Show at Tablao Flamenco El Arenal in Seville

events.description: Discover Catalonia beyond Barcelona with this full-day tour to the intriguing cities of Girona and Figueres. Uncover ancient Roman history and stroll through the winding medieval streets of one of Europe's best-preserved Jewish quarters in Girona, and then get surreal with a visit to the Dalí Museum in Figueres, birthplace of the groundbreaking artist.
events.name: Girona and Dali Museum in Figueres - Small Group Tour with Hotel pickup from Bcn

events.description: Be the first to step inside La Sagrada Familia just before the crowds arrive on this morning tour in Barcelona. This tour allows you inside the unfinished church before it is open to the general public. Learn from your guide about the famous Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí. Stroll among the columns as large as trees, admire the lavish decoration, and view the colorful stained glass windows that make this structure a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and upgrade to include access to the Tower. Afterwards, take a walk through nearby Parca de Gaudi if you wish.
events.name: Morning Access to Sagrada Familia with Optional Tower Access

events.description: While in Catalonia, gain morning access to the 1,000-year-old  Montserrat Monastery before anyone else with this tour. Just 30 miles (48 kilometers) outside of Barcelona, lies the monastery that still functions today. Follow your guide through the area, and admire its pristine architecture. Then, pop into the Museum of Montserrat, and explore its galleries with your guide close by to answer any questions along the way.
events.name: Morning Access to Montserrat Monastery from Barcelona

events.description: Discover the coastal splendor of the Costa Brava region on a full-day trip to Girona and Calella de Palafrugell from Barcelona. Travel through the scenic Catalan countryside, and discover the atmospheric streets of Girona’s medieval Old Town. Admire the flagrant fortresses of Pals, absorb the seaside charm of rural fishing village, Calella de Palafrugell, and admire the dramatic landscapes of Begur, the former home of an ancient castle. Receive personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour.
events.name: Girona and Costa Brava SMALL GROUP Tour from Barcelona

events.description: Discover the Alella wine region, located just outside Barcelona, in a unique way on this sailing excursion. Depart Port Olimpico and travel down the coast to the Alella harbor, taking in the sights and enjoying complimentary snacks while you sail. Then, board a bus to a family-run winery where you can learn about the regional variety and sample it during a tasting. Return to Barcelona in a private vehicle.
events.name: Sailing Trip to the Vineyards, Winery Tour & Wine Tasting - Premium Small Group

events.description: Discover the grandiose Royal Palace of Madrid with special early access and a guided tour. For a glimpse of the palace at its most spectacular, arrive before the doors open to the public, then learn the secrets of the enormous palace, whose 2,800 rooms overflow with masterpiece artwork, period décor, and architectural detail. This Royal Palace tour includes skip-the-line early admission tickets to the Royal Palace.
events.name: Skip-The-Line Early Entrance Tour of the Royal Palace of Madrid

events.description: See the best of Barcelona on a packaged trip combining two excursions, including visits to the Barcelona Cathedral, the Gothic Quarter, Olympic Village (Vila Olimpica), Montjuic Castle, Montserrat and much more. Your trip includes a ride by cog-wheel train to the Royal Basilica of Monserrat to admire the site's 12-century Black Virgin and sample some local liquor. Hop aboard the Montjuic cable car for a bird's-eye view of the city, including the magnificent La Sagrada Familia and harbor.
events.name: Barcelona Combo: Highlights Barcelona and Montserrat Sightseeing Tour

events.description: With just one day in Granada, a visit to the UNESCO-listed Alhambra Palace is a must, but you might find yourself wasting hours queuing outside. This full-day tour from Seville ensures you make the most of your time, with hotel pickup and round-trip transport; skip-the-line entrance and a guided tour of the Alcazaba, Nasrid Palace, and Generalife Gardens; plus an optional walking tour of the historic Albaicin neighborhood.
events.name: Full-day Skip-the-line Granada, Alhambra Palace and Albaicin tour from Seville

events.description: Explore the crown jewel of medieval Granada on a tour of the Alhambra, and gain skip-the-line entry to the Moorish palace and fortress complex. Together with the Generalife gardens, they form a UNESCO World Heritage site. Learn about the Nasrid dynasty as well as Muslim, Jewish and Christian history during a walking tour with your informative guide.
events.name: Alhambra and Generalife Small-Group Guided Tour in Granada

events.description: Visit the Sagrada Familia with a private guide and skip-the-line tickets for the ultimate experience of Barcelona's must-see site. Renowned architect Antoni Gaudi started working on this stunning cathedral in 1882, and it is considered one or his masterpieces. Your expert guide explains the history and symbolism of the architectural details and shares informative commentary throughout the 2-hour tour. If you are traveling with children, you can take a family-oriented tour that includes a scavenger hunt for the younger set.
events.name: Sagrada Familia Express Private Guided Tour

events.description: Visit the Loro Park Zoo and Siam Park water park with this dual admission ticket. Admire the diverse and extensive species of animals at Loro Park, which is known for its collection of parrots. Stroll through the orchid garden and admire the many varieties. At Siam Park, enjoy the Thai-themed architecture and water rides that are fun for the whole family.
events.name: Loro and Siam Park Twin Ticket

events.description: Discover Barcelona's incredible Sagrada Familia cathedral, a UNESCO World Heritage site, during this skip-the-line visit. Join a guide as you bypass the lengthy lines, exploring this this sublime structure (still under construction more than 130 years after work began) and learning about its creator, Antoni Gaudí. Visit the museum beneath the cathedral and then scale one of the cathedral's sky-high spires with a skip-the-line tower ticket, enjoying panoramic vistas of Barcelona from up above.
events.name: Priority Access: Barcelona Sagrada Familia Tour with Optional Tower Entry

events.description: Visit 3 wineries and taste more than 10 wines in Madrid Wine Region (D.O Vinos de Madrid). Escape the metropolitan mayhem of Madrid in favor of the verdant vineyards of Vinos de Madrid on a full-day Spanish wine tour. Accompanied by an accomplished guide, explore the beautiful wine-making region and learn about complex production processes in atmospheric wine cellars, known as bodegas. Sample signature wines grown in the area and gain fascinating insight into the culinary heritage of Spain’s capital city on this enriching epicurean tour.
events.name: Small-Group Wine Tasting Day Trip from Madrid

events.description: Experience the fever of flamenco dancing during a show in one of Spain’s most esteemed ‘tablaos’ (flamenco venues) in Madrid. Select a show time convenient for you, then venture to the beating heart of Madrid’s Old Town to experience an evening of music and dance. Enjoy a welcome drink or upgrade to include a 3-, 4-, or 5-course feast of Spanish specialties. Then take in a passionate performance from some of Spain’s top dancers.
events.name: Flamenco Show at Corral de la Morería in Madrid

events.description: Experience the passion and energy of Spain's most celebrated art form with a live flamenco show at La Taberna de Mister Pinkleton, a Madrid institution since the 1960s. In an intimate and atmospheric venue, watch a small group of dancers and musicians bring to life the stories and soul of flamenco in an authentic, 1.5-hour performance. Sip an included drink during the show, or upgrade to include dinner of typical Spanish selections complete with dessert and wine from the well-stocked bar.
events.name: Flamenco Show in Madrid at La Taberna de Mister Pinkleton

events.description: Visit the Alcazar of Seville (Real Alcazar) on a tour that shows off the top features of the royal palace, such as the Patio de las Doncellas. Learn about the various styles of architecture that the palace is known for, particularly Mudejar, and enjoy skip-the-line access with a guide.
events.name: Alcázar of Seville Tour (Tickets included & Skip the line)

events.description: Enhance your experience of the Alcázar of Seville with entry before normal opening hours and skip-the-line access. Follow your guide into parts of the palace not accessible to regular tour groups. Appreciate the mix of mudéjar, Renaissance, and 19th-century architecture as you pass through areas like the Patio of the Maidens, the Ambassador's Room, and the English gardens. Upgrade to include skip-the-line entry and a guided tour of Seville Cathedral—one of the largest Gothic cathedrals in the world—and access to UNESCO-listed landmark La Giralda.
events.name: Alcazar of Seville Early Access with Optional Seville Cathedral

events.description: Thousands visit Granada’s Alhambra each day and daily numbers are capped to help protect the complex. Book in advance to avoid disappointment and save vacation time with this skip-the-line audio guide ticket. Simply collect your ticket and audio guide at the entrance, bypass the ticket-purchase lines, and explore the Nasrid Palaces, Generalife, Alcazaba, and more your own way, dipping in and out of the audio commentary as you wish.
events.name: Alhambra Ticket with Audio Guide including Nasrid Palaces

events.description: Immerse yourself in the world of Salvador Dalí, and learn about his life and works, on this day trip to Figueres and the Costa Brava from Barcelona. Admire paintings and other mind-bending creations by the 20th-century Spanish artist at the stunning Salvador Dalí Museum in his birthplace of Figueres. Then, tour his beloved Costa Brava to see some of his favorite places, such as the Salvador Dalí House in Port Lligat, and Pubol Castle, a later Salvador Dali home. Numbers are limited on this tour for a more personalized experience.
events.name: Salvador Dali Museum, Port Lligat, and Cadaques SMALL GROUP tour from Barcelona

events.description: Rise to exhilarating elevations over the medieval myriad of Toledo or Segovia on a hot-air balloon ride from Madrid. Select the city you want to see from above then rise to dizzying heights and enjoy birds-eye views of Toledo’s charming Old Town and Segovia’s ancient aqueduct.Touch down and pamper your palate with a Spanish brunch featuring cava and cured meats. Bring home a flight certificate and after a few days enjoy the photographs and video that immortalize your magical memories and upgrade to enjoy the convenience of round-trip transportation from your Madrid hotel.
events.name: Hot Air Balloon Ride Over Toledo or Segovia with Optional Transport from Madrid

events.description: Explore two of Spain's oldest cities on a day trip from Madrid without the hassle of renting a car or figuring out train and bus services. This guided tour takes you to Avila and Segovia, two cities that are so rich in history and architecture that they are known as Spain's Heritage of Mankind cities.
events.name: Avila y Segovia Full Day Tour from Madrid

events.description: Enjoy a hassle-free visit to Granada with a package that includes round-trip transfer service from Malaga and tickets to two top attractions. Travel in comfort in a well-equipped minibus, and use the provided admission tickets to visit the Alhambra and Nasrid Palaces. The itinerary has free time to explore on your own, and includes a guided tour of the Alhambra—a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
events.name: Guided Tour of the Alhambra from Malaga and Costa del Sol

events.description: Sample the unique history and renowned wine producers of Ribera del Duero during this 10.5-hour trip from Madrid. Stop by three wineries during your trip, each of which offers a different setting mixing modern, traditional and medieval architecture, to taste the vintages from one of the most famous wine regions in the world. Get an in-depth look at wine production and harvesting during one stop and also have time to explore this ancient region’s wealth of medieval villages and castles. An expert guide, plus seasonal lunch, entrance fees, tastings and transport are included.
events.name: Guided Wine Day Tour to Ribera del Duero from Madrid

events.description: Travel from Madrid to Spain’s medieval, UNESCO-listed cities Avila and Salamanca. Visit the Avila Cathedral and Basilica of St. Vincent in Avila, and then head to Salamanca to see its famous university and Plaza Mayor. Enjoy a hassle-free experience with comfortable round-trip transport from a central meeting point in Madrid and all of your entrance fees included.
events.name: Avila and Salamanca Tour from Madrid

events.description: Be swept up in the passion of Andalucian flamenco at Barcelona’s Tablao de Carmen, one of the city’s best-known ‘tablaos’ or flamenco bars. Make your own way to the tablao in the Spanish Village and enjoy an electrifying flamenco show of flamboyant dancing, singing, hand clapping and rousing guitar music. Choose from two show times and opt to enjoy a drink, tapas or 3-course dinner before the performance. Your experience includes admission to the Spanish Village, a recreation of a traditional Spanish town filled with craft shops, cafés and museums.
events.name: Flamenco Evening Experience at Tablao de Carmen with Dinner or Drink

events.description: Explore the Royal Basilica and Monastery of Montserrat independently on this half-day trip from Barcelona. Travel by coach to the spectacular, mountainside Benedictine abbey, one of Spain’s most popular pilgrimage sites for its revered Black Madonna statue. Then, enjoy free time to explore, making this one of the most flexible Montserrat tours from Barcelona available. Admire the views from the mountainside, see the vast basilica and venerated statue, visit the audiovisual museum, and perhaps hear the Escolania, one of Europe’s best-known boys’ choirs before your return to Barcelona.
events.name: Montserrat Royal Basilica Half-Day Trip from Barcelona

events.description: Cover the best of Barcelona on this full-day tour. Visit the city’s most famous attractions and landmarks such as the Gothic Quarter, Plaza Catalunya, Montjuic and more as you learn about Barcelona’s history from your informative guide. This comprehensive tour also includes skip-the-line access to three popular attractions: Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, and La Pedrera allowing guests to spend more time enjoying the iconic places rather than standing in line. Enjoy a light breakfast of Italian pastries, an Ibericus ham tasting, and bottled water throughout the day as an additional treat.
events.name: Full Day Guided Tour & Skip the Line: Sagrada Familia, Park Güell & La Pedrera

events.description: Discover Barcelona your way on a private tour with a personal guide who makes sure you see the city’s top attractions, or you can customize the itinerary to your own preferences. Perhaps visit famous Gaudí landmarks like Sagrada Familia or Park Güell, explore the Gothic Quarter, or visit La Rambla, Barcelona’s bustling tree-lined promenade. This tour includes air-conditioned transportation, pickup from your hotel or cruise port, and the option to choose skip-the-line entry to select attractions when booking.
events.name: Private Guided Barcelona tour: customize the tour, skip-the-lines, enjoy pickup

events.description: Get a taste for the top attractions in Barcelona during this 8-hour excursion covering the many highlights of the Catalan capital. Tour Passeig de Gracia, an elegant boulevard that hosts a wealth of modernist architecture like La Pedrera and Casa Batlló, before discovering Antoni Gaudí's Park Güell and La Sagrada Familia. You’ll also explore the incredible history of Barcelona’s Gothic Quarter before finishing with sublime city views from on top of Montjüic. A guide and round-trip hotel transport are included.
events.name: Barcelona in One Day: Sagrada Familia, Park Guell & Old Town with Hotel Pick-up

events.description: Venture to the ancient and culturally diverse city of Gibraltar on an exciting full-day excursion from Seville. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, immerse yourself in the intricate cultural tapestry of the city; gaze at the dramatic landmark of the Rock of Gibraltar; explore the subterranean depths of St. Michael’s Cave; then frolic with the famous monkeys who inhabit the island. Explore independently during a relaxed afternoon and treat your taste buds to the traditional flavors of Spanish cuisine in a rustic local restaurant (own expense).
events.name: Gibraltar Day Trip from Seville

events.description: Discover Andalusia on a 4-day tour of Cordoba, Seville, and Granada with a guide. Travel from Madrid in an air-conditioned vehicle to Cordoba, where you'll take a guided tour of the UNESCO-listed city and its impressive monuments. Spend two nights in the regional capital, Seville, and then explore the Alhambra in Granada, another World Heritage Site. Conclude your excursion with a stroll around the walled city of Toledo.
events.name: Andalusia and Toledo - 4 DayTour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/129387P31/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: PRIVATE Guided Tour to The Alhambra, Nasrid Palaces, Alcazaba and Generalife

events.description: Experience the highlights of Spain’s Andalucia region on this 6-day tour from Madrid. Traveling by air-conditioned coach with an expert guide, visit six Andalucian jewels: Caceres, Cordoba, Seville, Ronda, Granada, Toledo, and drive along the sun-baked Costa del Sol coast. Enjoy a combination of sightseeing tours and free time in each destination, plus guided visits to sights such as Granada’s UNESCO-listed Alhambra. Your 6-day tour includes hotel accommodation, coach transport, daily breakfasts and dinners.
events.name: Andalusia with Costa del Sol and Toledo - 6 Day Tour

events.description: Uncover the alluring mystery of Morocco on an immersive full-day trip to Tangier from Costa del Sol. Cruise over the Strait of Gibraltar and enjoy incredible ocean views before arriving amid the exotic scents and sights of Tangier. With a knowledgeable guide, stroll around bustling medinas and souks; observe a Berber typical performance; feast upon the explosive flavors of an authentic Moroccan lunch; and purchase bespoke souvenirs at a Tangier bazaar. Enjoy the convenience of round-trip transportation from Costa del Sol.
events.name: Tangier, Morocco Day Trip from Costa del Sol

events.description: Follow in the footsteps of the Lannisters and the Targaryens on this 8-hour 'Game of Thrones'  tour in Girona. This experience allows you to explore the medieval city through the eyes of key characters such as Tyrion Lannister, and stop at filming sites from the show. Sample 'King’s Hand' ice cream, a flavor invented by locals in honor of the series, and enjoy free time to see the city’s Roman walls and Jewish district. Ice cream isn't the only food provided—you'll also enjoy lunch.
events.name: 'Game Of Thrones' SMALL GROUP Tour in Girona from Barcelona

events.description: As one of the top attractions in Barcelona, La Sagrada Familia draws large crowds of visitors daily. Don't waste time waiting to get inside: this small-group tour includes priority access, giving you more time to soak up the astonishing architecture of the interiors.
events.name: Sagrada Familia Fast Track Entrance Premium Guided Tour

events.description: Experience the natural splendor of Montserrat and the Benedictine abbey of Santa Maria on this enriching full-day excursion from Barcelona. Escape the crowds and chaos of the city on a Mercedes Cabrio minibus to discover ancient 12th-century carvings and holy pilgrimage sites with a knowledgeable guide. Board a glass-bottomed funicular railway to observe the region’s fascinating flora and fauna then follow a natural trail replete with verdant beauty in Montserrant Natural Park. Enjoy personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour, where numbers are limited to 15 people.
events.name: Montserrat Monastery & Hiking Tour with Cable Car Included from Barcelona

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/169630P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Guided visit in Prado Museum | English | 6 people per group | Skip the line

events.description: Treat all of your senses to a dose of Spanish culture with a flamenco and dinner package in Madrid. Booking in advance guarantees you a seat in the legendary Torres Bermejas, a tablao (flamenco venue) where some of the greatest names in flamenco have performed. Plus, your experience is completed by a tapas selection inspired by classic Spanish cuisine. Choose from two showtimes.
events.name: Flamenco Show and Special Menu at Torres Bermejas in Madrid

events.description: Travel through the wine regions of Penedes and Pal de Bages on this full-day vineyard tour from Barcelona. Visit boutique wineries in each of these picturesque areas, and sample their singular cavas and wines, paired with traditional cuisine such as tapas and traditional meat cuts. Your expert guide shares local knowledge about the region’s wine and cuisine.
events.name: Penedes Wineries Small Group Tour with Wine, Cava and Tapas Tasting

events.description: Discover the spectacular sights of Barcelona on a half-day tour that explores sky, water, and land. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, stroll the serpentine streets of the Old Town to absorb the Gothic grandeur of the Gothic Quarter with its colossal Cathedral. Then, set off on a cruise on a stylish Turkish schooner boat; sail down the glittering river then disembark to experience an exhilarating helicopter ride. See the stunning sprawl of the city from a remarkable aerial perspective as you soar through the sky. Enjoy an intimate atmosphere on this small-group tour, with numbers limited to 12.
events.name: Helicopter Flight, Walking Tour and Boat Cruise Barcelona Premium Small Group

events.description: Become more acquainted with Spain’s Penedes region on this cava-and-wine-tasting tour that sets off from Barcelona. Visit a winery which has been cultivating vines for more than 2,000 years, where you’ll travel through its vineyards on a 4x4 Jeep. Hear from a viticulturist who can explain the nitty-gritty of wine production. Plus, during your tour, get the opportunity to taste four wines, four glasses of cava, and indulge in a variety of tapas dishes.
events.name: Local Wine and Cava with Tapas and 4WD Vineyard Experience Premium Small-Group from Barcelona

events.description: Plunge into the rich cultural tapestry of Morocco on a full-day trip to Tangier from Seville. Alongside your guide, you’ll travel to the African continent while absorbing views of the Bay of Tangier and the Strait of Gibraltar. On arrival in Tangier, you’ll plunge into the whitewashed cascade of buildings on a guided walking tour; see the opulent Dar el Makhzen palace, stroll the narrow streets of the medina and learn about the history and culture of the Moroccan metropolis. Lunch and round-trip transfers from Seville hotels are included.
events.name: Full-Day Tour: Tangier from Seville

events.description: Make the most of your vacation time in Granada by booking this skip-the-line private tour of the famous Alhambra. This top Granada attraction often has long lines, which you breeze right past with your prepaid tickets and dedicated guide. You and your party follow your private guide through the fortress complex to see and learn about the most important features, listening to in-depth commentary on the history and architecture of the site.
events.name: Alhambra Private Tour: Endless Experiences With Skip the line

events.description: Embark on a half-day 4WD adventure in Sierra Nevada National Park that’s tailor-made to provide the most spectacular views of snow-capped peaks, white mountain villages and Mediterranean forests. Access remote and less-visited sections of the park, and enjoy a drink at an alpine restaurant while soaking up panoramic vistas.
events.name: 4WD Sierra Nevada Safari Tour in Granada

events.description: Explore Casa Batlló, Antoni Gaudi's architectural masterpiece, with a smart guide. Learn about Gaudi's life and artistic visions as you look around the Modernist building, one of the most eye-catching in Barcelona.
events.name: Gaudi's Casa Batlló Admission Ticket with Smart Guide

events.description: Enhance your experience of a treasured landmark during a guided tour of the UNESCO-listed Alcázar of Seville. Purchase a skip-the-line entrance ticket and sail past the long lines with your priority-access pass. Alongside your guide, you’ll embark on a tour of expansive courtyards, Gothic chambers and the palace’s beautiful gardens. Learn about the fascinating history of the Alcázar of Seville and received personalized attention on this small-group tour.
events.name: Fast-Track Seville Guided Tour into Alcazar

events.description: Experience the beauty and passion of Flamenco in an intimate setting. The Casa de la Memoria is a 15th-century palace in central Seville that now plays host to top flamenco performers. Each show features four performers: two dancers, a singer, and a guitar player.  The venue is small enough that they don’t require microphones, the music carries throughout the hall.
events.name: Flamenco Show at Casa de la Memoria Admission Ticket

events.description: Explore the seas around Tenerife on this small-group cruise in a genuine and tasteful sailing boat. Enjoy snacks and drinks on board as you watch dolphins and whales swim by and listen to their calls with state-of-the-art sonar equipment. The captain of the boat is an experienced local sailor who answers any questions about these spectacular animals. After lunch, provided on board, take some time to jump on the water and swim or snorkel.
events.name: Whale and Dolphin Watching Sailing Boat with Drinks, Snacks and Swimming Time

events.description: Discover the legacy of Spain’s powerful Nasrid dynasty on a private tour of the UNESCO-listed Alhambra citadel and Generalife gardens in Granada. From Moorish sultans to Catholic kings, hear stories from the centuries of rulers who occupied this stunning royal complex and adjacent gardens while an official guide reveals the secrets behind their multicultural history and design.
events.name: Alhambra and Generalife Private Guided Tour in Granada

events.description: Marvel at the architectural spectacle of Andalucia’s White Villages on a full-day tour to Zahara de la Sierra and Ronda from Seville. Travel through the beautiful Spanish countryside, stopping briefly at the medieval Castle of Las Aguzaderas, to Zahara de la Sierra, a hilltop village famed for its rich history and panoramic vistas. Admire the flower baskets and pristine white houses of Grazelema; explore a beautiful Mediterranean forest; and visit the iconic Puente Nuevo in the historical city of Ronda.
events.name: White Villages Guided Day Tour from Seville

events.description: Venture east from Barcelona to Spain’s Costa Brava, and spend the day discovering one of Europe’s prettiest shorelines. Journey along the coast to this famous seaside stretch, known for its rugged cliffs and pine groves, and stop near the lively resort of Blanes. Sunbathe or swim in a tucked-away sandy cove, or choose to stroll through the cliff-edge Marimurtra Botanical Gardens. After a tasty 3-course lunch at a traditional restaurant, enjoy free time to explore, shop, or relax in the charming town of Tossa de Mar.
events.name: Costa Brava SMALL GROUP Tour from Barcelona with Traditional Lunch

events.description: Discover the beauty of the Atlantic Ocean on this Bahriyeli boat tour from Los Cristianos Harbor. You won’t have to worry about missing a whale or dolphin sighting as you’ll have experienced crew members to answer your questions, and point out any marine sightings. You’ll escape the hustle and bustle of the city, and also get fantastic views and photo opportunities of Mount Teide, the Tenerife coastline, and marine life.
events.name: 2 HOUR -Tenerife Whale and Dolphin Cruise On Board the Bahriyeli

events.description: Lose yourself in the mesmerizing rhythms and dramatic costumes of the Spanish flamenco with a foot-stomping flamenco show at the Palacio del Flamenco in Barcelona. Prepare to be thoroughly entertained as you enjoy a thrilling hour-long performance accompanied by live musicians and cantaores (singers). For the ultimate experience, upgrade to include a glass of Sangria, traditional tapas or a delicious Spanish-style dinner.
events.name: Flamenco Show: Palacio del Flamenco in Barcelona

events.description: Delve into the eccentric imagination of Antoni Gaudi on a combo tour that combines two of Barcelona’s most interesting experiences. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, sail past the long lines at the entrance of La Sagrada Familia with a priority access pass and marvel at the inspiring interior of the famously unfinished church. Afterwards, explore the sculpted splendor of Park Güell and stroll down Passeig de Gràcia to see Pedrera and Casa Batlló, two of the architect’s most distinctive and dynamic designs.
events.name: Combo Tour: Fast Track Sagrada Familia & Park Güell with the Best of Gaudí

events.description: Experience relaxation and adventure during this catamaran tour from Puerto Calero for Papagayo beaches. While on board, sip drinks and soak up the sun, or help the crew sail. Once the boat has anchored in a bay, swim, snorkel, or up the speed with a Jet-Ski ride. Choose between morning or afternoon departures, and family-friendly or adult-only sailings. Onboard lunch included.
events.name: Catlanza Catamaran Sailing in Lanzarote

events.description: Watching a traditional Flamenco performance is a highlight of any visit to Andalusia and this 1.5-hour dinner show is located in one of Granada’s most spectacular venues. Take your seats in the atmospheric cave-restaurant of El Templo del Flamenco, tuck into a delicious 2- or 5-course dinner, and be entertained by a thrilling live flamenco show.
events.name: 1 Hour Flamenco Show in a Cave-Restaurant in Granada

events.description: Dive into the unique history of Seville, while tasting some of the best tapas the city has to offer on this 3.5-hour food and culture tour. Walk the streets as your guide leads you to four bars, 10 tastes and 5+ drinks— more than enough food to compensate for dinner. As you go, learn about the city’s 2,000-year-old past and its connections with Christopher Columbus, Julius Caesar, and the Spanish Inquisition.
events.name: Tapas, Taverns & History Tour

events.description: Capture the alpine spirit of Montserrat on a 4-hour tour from Barcelona. Aboard a comfortable, climate-controlled coach, drive along the Llobregat River through picturesque villages to reach the 4,051-foot (1,234-meter) mountain. Visit the Royal Basilica of Montserrat and listen to your guide's commentary on the history and legends of the mountain. Take some free time to explore the paths, stairs, caves, chapels and hermitages scattered all over the mountain on your own. Round-trip transportation (approximately 1 hour each way) from a central Barcelona meeting point is included.
events.name: Half-Day Guided Montserrat Tour in Barcelona

events.description: Unless you line up first thing in the morning, getting into the Alcázar of Seville can take hours. Bypass the long lines when you book this skip-the-line sightseeing tour in advance. After you breeze past the crowds, your guide shows you around the royal palace, sharing stories and fun facts along the way, then leaves you to linger in the gardens on your own.
events.name: Seville Royal Alcazar: Skip-the-Long-Line Guided Tour

events.description: Taste the best of Catalonia’s culture and gourmet cuisine on this Barcelona tapas tour through the city on foot. During your pre-dinner outing, explore some of the city’s most famous tapas bars around La Rambla, La Boqueria food market, and the Gothic Quarter with an expert food guide, learning how to order these iconic bar snacks like a local.
events.name: Barcelona Culture Tapas Walking Tour

events.description: Uncover the secrets of Spanish cuisine with a traditional cooking class in Madrid. Get hands on as you create classic dishes such as tapas, gazpacho, or paella; master new skills under the guidance of an expert chef; then sit down to feast on your homemade creations, accompanied by a glass of Sangria.
events.name: 4-hour Spanish Cooking Class in Madrid

events.description: Immerse yourself in the architecture and creative work of artistic genius Antoni Gaudí on this afternoon excursion in Barcelona. Take some time to admire the designer's UNESCO World Heritage-listed La Sagrada Familia before heading to Gaudí's iconic Park Güell for a skip-the-line visit. Spend time exploring the park's wealth of mosaic-adorned benches, walls, and sculptures before heading back to the city center to explore the Gaudí-designed residences of Casa Batlló and La Pedrera (Casa Milà).
events.name: La Sagrada Familia and Skip-the-Line Entry to Park Guell

events.description: Visit Toledo for a day from Madrid on this guided tour of the UNESCO World Heritage Site. Embark from central Madrid, and enjoy guided visits of Toledo Cathedral, the Jewish District, and more. The tour includes free time for you to explore on your own, visiting more sights or stop for a bite to eat.
events.name: Full Toledo with 7 Monuments and Optional Cathedral Access

events.description: Take a guided tour of Parc Güell, designed by renowned architect Antoni Gaudí and arguably Barcelona's most beautiful public space. Follow your guide on an in-depth exploration of this magnificent site, checking out some of its most picturesque sights and learning fascinating facts about its eccentric designer, Gaudí. Along the way you're sure to enjoy the park's intricate tile work, colorful architecture, and stunning city views afforded by its hilltop location. Your Parc Güell tour also includes entrance fees at the site.
events.name: Skip the Line Guided Walking Tour: Gaudi's Park Guell in Barcelona

events.description: Say ‘bon voyage’ to the last rays of the day during this sunset sailing trip along the Barcelona coast. Join your professional skipper amidst the luxurious yachts of the city’s Port Vell marina, casting off for an early evening adventure just offshore. As you sail, you’ll enjoy top-notch views of the city, coastline and the fiery-orange light show of the setting sun. Included snacks and beverages on board help ensure you can stay focused on the scenery instead of your stomach.
events.name: Sunset Sailing Experience from Port Vell in Barcelona

events.description: Exploring Avila and Segovia—two of Spain’s oldest cities—from Madrid in a day can be tricky without a self-drive car. This full-day coach tour is the easy option, with the added bonus of a guide to chart the cities’ history, and included walking tours and entry fees. Check out Avila’s walls, Cathedral, and Basilica; and then continue to Segovia to take in its towering Roman aqueduct, Alcazar, and Cathedral.
events.name: Avila y Segovia Full Day Tour from Madrid With Tickets Included

events.description: When your cruise ship sails into the pretty port of Palma de Mallorca, embark on an exploration of the idyllic island on a private 6-hour shore excursion. Admire seaside splendor as you venture to the traditional village of Valldemossa, a place replete with colorful flowers and antique architecture. Gain cultural insight into the villages of Deia and the verdant Soller Valley; sample seafood specialties in the coastal town of Port Solier; and absorb panoramic vistas of the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Serra de Tramuntana mountain range. Entry fees and food and drink are not included in this tour.
events.name: Palma de Mallorca Shore Excursion: Private Tour of Valldemossa, Soller and Serra de Tramuntana

events.description: Discover one of Tenerife’s most thrilling and extensive waterparks on your next trip. Opened in 2008, Siam Park features waterslides, a lazy river, a wave pool, and many more attractions. Secure your admission in advance, and choose from a number of different tour options: standard admission, admission with included lunch, a deluxe pass with all-inclusive service and a fast pass, or Champagne club entry which comes with a bottle of bubbly.
events.name: Siam Park Direct Entry Ticket

events.description: Board a cog train and journey to a monastery hidden among the peaks of Barcelona's Montserrat mountain. This private guided tour offers a more personalized experience than is typical. Visit the Church of Santa Maria de Montserrat where you will see 'la moreneta,' also known as the 'black Madonna', and hear the Children’s Chorus of Montserrat, before hiking to a scenic viewpoint.
events.name: Private tour to Montserrat! The most complete tour, cog train & meal included!!

events.description: See the historical and natural highlights of Barcelona and its scenic surroundings on an exhilarating full-day excursion. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, visit legendary landmarks such as La Sagrada Familia and Montjuic Hill, and then sail past the long lines at renowned architect’s Antoni Gaudi’s Park Güell. Venture to Montserrat National Park to enjoy the natural splendor of the scenery, and absorb the sacred ambiance of Montserrat Montserrat, the park’s beautiful basilica. Enjoy personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour, where numbers are limited to 12.
events.name: Barcelona and Montserrat tour: skip-the-line at Park Güell & enjoy direct pickup

events.description: Admire the spectacular sights of Spain’s vibrant capital on a bicycle tour of Madrid. With a knowledgeable guide, cycle at a leisurely pace to important monuments like Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace of Madrid. Stop intermittently to listen to illuminating commentary from your expert guide, and to capture photographs of Madrid’s historical and architectural highlights. All safety equipment is included on this tour.
events.name: 3hr. Best of Madrid Tour by bike

events.description: Experience a relaxing day in the countryside and plenty of wine-tasting during this day trip to some of the top wineries outside Barcelona. Head to the Penedès region, to visit some of the most famous wineries of Catalonia, stopping to taste and learn about the production of the area's many vintages and cava (Catalan sparkling wine) along the way. During your visit, enjoy the services of a guide, who escorts you between wineries and share informative and fun facts about the region during your trip. This Catalonia winery tour includes tastings at three vineyards plus cheeses and tapas.
events.name: Wine and Cava Day Trip from Barcelona

events.description: Gaudi’s magnificent La Sagrada Familia cathedral is one of Barcelona’s most visited attractions and this tour saves you potentially hours of time with skip-the-line tickets. Also on this tour, enjoy a walking tour of Barcelona’s Old Town and Gothic Quarter; admire Modernist architecture including Casa Batlló, Hospital de Sant Pau, and Casa Lleó; and take in the views from Montjuïc Mountain.
events.name: Barcelona and Sagrada Familia Small Group Half Day Tour with Hotel Pick-up

events.description: Skip the line for entrance tickets and spend more of your time exploring Spain's famed Alhambra Palace and Generalife gardens on this guided tour. Enjoy the privilege of priority entrance and be one of the first to enter the grounds and step back into Granada’s Muslim past whilst exploring the palace and fortress. Get insight into the gardens' features and a deeper look at the region’s history from your guide, before exploring farther independently.
events.name: Skip-The-Line Alhambra and Generalife Expert Guided Tour

events.description: Described by Moorish poets as “a pearl set in emeralds,” the Alhambra is indeed the jewel of Granada. Discover the legends behind the beauty on this private 3-hour tour of the entire Alhambra palace complex, which includes skip-the-line admission to Granada’s most popular attraction. This tour can accommodate your group of one to 20 people, and includes a choice of morning, afternoon, or evening departure.
events.name: Alhambra, Nasrid Palaces, Generalife and Alcazaba Private Tour in Granada

events.description: Explore the landmark hailed as one of Gaudi’s most inspired creations on this skip-the-line audio tour of La Pedrera. Sail past long lines with your priority access pass and enjoy leisurely exploration of the modernist masterpiece with an informative audio guide. Gain fascinating insight into the architect’s innovative vision and inspiration for the surreal structure, in which spiraling chimneys and undulating lines compete for attention. Delve into Gaudi’s past by visiting the Espai Gaudi museum on the top floor and stroll over the decorative swirls of courtyards within the complex.
events.name: Skip the Line: Gaudi’s La Pedrera Audio Tour in Barcelona

events.description: Skip the famously long lines at Barcelona’s most popular attraction on a private tour of the Sagrada Familia. Exploring the expansive church with a personal guide enables you to learn easy-to-miss historical details about Antoni Gaudi’s masterpiece. Plus, a private tour lets travelers go at their own pace, making it ideal for families or elderly visitors.
events.name: Gaudi & Sagrada Familia! The most original private tour -skip the line tickets!!

events.description: This is the ideal tour for travelers looking for a comprehensive Gaudi experience. Save hours researching where to find the best examples of Gaudi’s work by having a guide to lead the way. On your action-packed day, visit Casa Batlló, La Pedrera, Park Guell, and Sagrada Família. Conveniently, all tickets are included so you won’t have to wait in long visitor lines. Headsets are provided too, so you’ll hear your guide's commentary loud and clear.
events.name: Complete Gaudí Tour: Casa Batlló, Park Guell & Sagrada Família with Tower Climb

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/161628P3/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Half-Day Sightseeing in Barcelona

events.description: Discover Seville’s highlights on this City Sightseeing hop-on hop-off tour. Use your 24-hour ticket to admire the landmarks aboard an open-top double-decker bus that includes audio commentary. Hop on and off as you wish at any of the 14 stops around the city, including the ornate Plaza de España and Tower of Gold. Your ticket also includes entry to several Seville museums and other attractions; and three walking tours from select stops, including a stroll around Seville Cathedral and the buzzing Macarena neighborhood.
events.name: City Sightseeing Seville Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour

events.description: Discover the magnificent landscapes that surround Tenerife’s Mt. Teide and the Masca Valley on an exhilarating full-day excursion. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, travel through the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Teide National Park on a voyage of natural discovery; gaze at sweeping volcanic panoramas and capture photographs of the island’s unique dragon tree. Ascend to Vilaflor, one of Spain’s highest villages, and enjoy leisurely time in Masca and Garachico, provincial villages cradled by rolling hills. Enjoy convenient round-trip transportation on this fascinating tour.
events.name: Mt. Teide and Masca Valley Tour in Tenerife

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/6874P107/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Montserrat Monastery with Cable Car Included & Lunch in a Traditional Farmhouse

events.description: Explore beyond the borders of Spain with a daytrip across the strait of Gibraltar to Tangier in Morocco. After hotel pick-up in Seville, travel to the port town of Tarifa and board a ferry to Tangier. Follow your guide on a walking tour through the bazaar and the medina, or old town. Relax over a traditional Moroccan lunch and visit a 19th century lighthouse at Spartel Cape. Camel rides on the beach are optional.
events.name: Tangier Day Trip from Seville

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/113310P10/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private tour from Malaga to the Alhambra Palace and Granada for up to 8 persons

events.description: Make the most out of your visit to the Alcazar of Seville, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, on this education cultural tour. With a guide in the lead, learn all about its history and architecture and ensure you don't miss a thing. Traveling with a small group ensures personalized attention from your guide and an intimate atmosphere while you explore the oldest European royal palace still in use.
events.name: Alcazar of Seville Small Group Guided Tour

events.description: Enjoy beautiful mountain scenery, history, and wine during this 10-hour, small-group excursion that includes a visit to Montserrat Monastery and a winery tasting near Barcelona. Drive by air-conditioned van to the hilltop religious site of Montserrat, where you'll enjoy spectacular views and see the Black Virgin, a 12th-century religious icon. Then head to Sant Sadurni d'Anoia, the nexus of Catalonia's wine industry, where you'll visit a winery for a tasting. Along the way you'll get personal attention from your knowledgeable guide.
events.name: Montserrat Monastery with Cava & Wine Tasting SMALL GROUP Tour from Barcelona

events.description: Enhance your experience of two top Madrid region attractions on this half-day tour of El Escorial and the Valley of the Fallen (Valle de los Caidos). Delve into the opulent beauty of El Escorial, a palatial and monastic complex home to a striking basilica and a marble pantheon, and then marvel at the Valley of the Fallen’s colossal cross, dedicated to lives lost in the Spanish Civil War. This small-group tour is limited to 15 people.
events.name: El Escorial and Valley of the Fallen from Madrid

events.description: Discover the cultural melting pot of Cordoba on a full-day tour of the multi-faceted metropolis from Seville. Follow a knowledgeable guide through the ambient tangle of whitewashed courtyards, cobbled lanes and alluring landmarks and see UNESCO World Heritage-listed wonders like the Mezquita and the Alcazar. Visit Spain’s oldest synagogue and amble along the medieval streets of the Jewish quarter while gaining fascinating insight into the intriguing history of the city home to the second-largest old town in Europe.
events.name: Cordoba Day Trip from Seville

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/170936P3/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: olive oil and wine culture tour

events.description: Skip the lines at one of the most popular tourist destinations in Spain on a guided tour through the elaborate architecture, grounds, and history of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Alhambra fortress, Nasrid Palaces, and Generalife gardens each have their own fascinating history. So, without waiting in line at any of the sites, you have ample time to explore and learn about the surroundings from your guide.
events.name: Alhambra Nasrid Palaces & Generalife Semiprivate Guided Tour

events.description: Set sail for the idyllic island of La Graciosa on a full-day cruise from Lanzarote and soak up the scenery aboard a luxury catamaran. Explore the village of Caleta del Sebo, cruise along the island’s south coast, and tuck into a traditional Spanish paella lunch with sangria, then enjoy swimming, snorkeling, or kayaking at the French Beach.
events.name: Full-Day La Graciosa Catamaran Cruise from Lanzarote

events.description: Mountainside Montserrat Monastery is a must-see in Barcelona, but traveling there independently means contending with driving, parking, or train or bus timetables. This guided tour eliminates the effort and combines your visit with an early morning hot air balloon ride—a combo difficult to arrange alone. Admire the needle-shaped Montserrat peaks from above and then explore the monastery with a guide to learn facts about its history you’d otherwise miss.
events.name: Montserrat Hot-Air Balloon Experience & Monastery Visit - Premium Small Group

events.description: Tenerife’s Mt. Teide is a prime spot for viewing the stars and constellations of the night sky. Departing from south Tenerife resorts, this tour provides a ready-made stargazing experience: with high-tech telescopes and equipment that let you view the heavens in ways usually reserved for professional astronomers. See planets and deep-space phenomena, learn the science behind your observations, and enjoy a traditional Canarian dinner and Champagne to make your experience extra special.
events.name: Stargazing Experience - Telescope Observations on mount Teide

events.description: With its futuristic buildings and fascinating exhibits, the City of the Arts and Sciences is an attraction at the top of many Valencia itineraries. Combine a visit to the site with tapas and wine tasting on one of Valencia’s highest terraces on this small-group tour, limited to 12 people. Pose for photographs outside of the dynamic buildings, and then ascend to the rooftop terrace to indulge in a tasting menu of Valentian delicacies and regional wines. Drop-off to your hotel at the end of the experience is included.
events.name: City of Arts & Sciences Tour with Rooftop Wine Tasting and Tapas

events.description: Revel in the incredible mountain scenery of the Pyrenees Spain on this hiking day trip from Barcelona, with an experienced guide. Travel through the charming villages of the Pyrenees’ foothills by minivan, and ride a rack railway to the gorgeous Nuria Valley, a vision of green pastures and peaks overlooking a jewel-like lake. Drink in the setting and crisp air, and enjoy time to follow the hiking trails, go horse riding or boating, or visit a traditional restaurant. Numbers are limited on this small-group tour for a more personalized experience.
events.name: Pyrenees Mountains & Medieval Towns SMALL GROUP Day Trip from Barcelona

events.description: Enhance your experience of Seville's UNESCO-listed landmarks on a tour of the Alcázar of Seville, Seville Cathedral and Giralda Tower. Alongside your guide, you’ll delve into the opulent chambers of the Alcázar of Seville and gaze at the sky-splintering spires of Seville Cathedral — the largest Gothic cathedral in the world. Ascend to the summit of the Giralda Tower to absorb panoramic vistas of the city before bidding your guide a fond farewell.
events.name: Seville Guided Tour into Alcazar and Cathedral

events.description: Discover the beautiful Andalucia region on this 4-day tour from Madrid. Visit the cities of Cordoba, Seville, Granada, and Toledo and see famous landmarks such as the Jewish Quarter, the Real Alcázar, Plaza de España, Giralda Tower, the caves of Sacromonte, and Alhambra. Learn about the history of each city, sample some of the local cuisine, and absorb the Spanish culture throughout the tour.
events.name: 4-Day Guided Tour Cordoba, Seville, Granada and Toledo from Madrid

events.description: Ensure a smooth and stress-free start to your cruise by pre-booking a private departure transfer to Barcelona cruise port. Your driver will pick you up from your central Barcelona hotel, help with your luggage and drive you directly to your Barcelona cruise terminal by comfortable Sedan or minivan.
events.name: Barcelona Private Transfer from City Centre to Cruise Terminal

events.description: When your cruise ships sails into the picturesque port of Barcelona, disembark to discover the legendary landmarks of the city on a full-day shore excursion. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, marvel at the architectural extravagance of La Sagrada Familia and Parc Güell, and then ascend to the hilltop perch of Olympic monuments. Venture to the nearby national park of Montserrat to enjoy views of the rugged mountain peeks, and absorb the sacred ambiance of Montserrat Basilica during an intimate tour.
events.name: Barcelona & Montserrat: ultimate small-group tour with pickup and skip-the-lines

events.description: Take to the skies—and discover spectacular views of Tenerife that most travelers miss—on this beginner-friendly paragliding excursion. Following pickup from your area accommodation, travel via air-conditioned vehicle to the paragliding center. After getting acquainted with the gear and techniques, head to either Taucho or Ifonche (two of the island’s best paragliding locales) and take to the skies in the company of the 2018 Spanish Paragliding Champion. From the air, take in views of Tenerife’s volcanic scenery and coastal beauty.
events.name: Paragliding Epic Experience in Tenerife with the Spanish Champion Team

events.description: Avoid the crowds as you skip the line and get the inside scoop on some of the best art at Madrid’s iconic Prado museum on this 90-minute guided tour. This sprawling museum is nearly unparalleled in its collection of European art, but can also be overwhelming for new visitors. Let your guide introduce you to museum’s the top highlights and their fascinating backstories, including Diego Velazquez’s ‘Las Meninas’ and ‘The Annunciation’ by El Greco. Best of all, this small-group visit is limited to just 20 guests, ensuring a personalized experience.
events.name: Skip the Line: Prado Museum Tour in Madrid

events.description: When your cruise ship docks at the vibrant port of Cadiz, venture to the sublime city of Seville to see its gorgeous architectural array. On this exciting shore excursion, sail past long lines as you visit UNESCO World Heritage-listed highlights such as the Seville Cathedral and Royal Alcazar Palace. Stroll the serpentine streets of Santa Cruz on a guided walking tour, and enrich your knowledge of Andalusian culture with an accomplished guide. Personalized attention from your guide is guaranteed on this small group tour, where numbers are limited to 18 people.
events.name: Cadiz to Seville Shore Excursion: guided tour, skip-the-line, pickup, drop-off

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5574P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Barcelona: Evening Tour of Sagrada Familia with Expert Guide

events.description: Discover the spectacular sights of Seville on a private walking tour. Admire the impossibly intricate architecture of the Santa Maria Cathedral; ascend to the dizzying heights of the Giralda Bell Tower to enjoy spectacular views of the city; and explore the opulent chambers and gorgeous gardens of the Royal Alcazar Palace on a guided tour. Enjoy a stroll through the Santa Cruz quarter and upgrade to add a walk around Plaza de España. Entrance fees are included in the price of the tour.
events.name: Private Monumental Seville Walking Tour

events.description: Explore Cordoba’s exquisite Mosque-Cathedral (Mezquita) on a walking tour with an art historian guide. Your guide shares commentary about the sacred site, which was constructed in the eighth century as the Great Mosque, then was converted into a cathedral in the thirteenth century. This 75-minute tour reveals fascinating details about this important Spanish monument, which is located within the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Historic Centre of Cordoba.
events.name: Cordoba Mosque guided tour

events.description: Spend a day out in nature at the Caminito del Rey on this convenient day trip from Malaga. The boardwalk trails through the gorge and cliff faces are several miles long, and on the way your guide will tell you all about the history and geology of the amazing area. This tour is best suited to active travelers who aren’t afraid of heights.
events.name: Guided Tour: Caminito del Rey from Malaga

events.description: Flamenco is synonymous with Spanish culture but, for visitors, it can be hard to cut through the tourist traps to find an authentic performance. This show at the Centro Cultural Flamenco, Madrid offers an intimate and unforgettable experience of traditional flamenco.
events.name: Traditional Flamenco Show

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/34697P23/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Monuments of Seville: Cathedral, Alcazar and Giralda with Tickets

events.description: Feast your senses on the multi-sensory magnificence of a multimedia event within Gaudi’s La Pedrera. Immerse yourself in the unique majesty of an experience known as the 'La Pedrera Night Experience' and meander through the iconic landmark until you reach the rooftop, upon which a mesmerizing display of projections transform the architectural features into surreal and spectacular objects. Conclude your hypnotic evening with a chilled glass of cava as you admire the glittering lights of the city by night.
events.name: La Pedrera Night Experience: A Behind-Closed-Doors Tour in Barcelona

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/104043P10/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Exclusive Private tour to Toledo with licensed guide (from Toledo and Madrid)

events.description: Visit the Alhambra and Granada on a day-long excursion from Malaga. With a guide, explore the UNESCO-listed Alhambra palace, admiring incredible Islamic architecture around the complex. After visiting the main highlights, Charles V Palace, and the Generalife Gardens, check out the landmarks of Granada on a walking tour. Numbers are limited to 20 people, and the experience includes round-trip transport from Malaga.
events.name: Full Day to Alhambra Palace and Generalife Gardens Direct from Malaga

events.description: With over 3,000 rooms and a veritable museum worth's of paintings by the likes of Caravaggio and Velazquez, the Royal Palace of Madrid greets its visitors with nothing short of splendor.
