events.name: Tour to Westminster Abbey and the Houses of Parliament in London

events.description: Combine three popular attractions on one convenient day tour of Oxford, Windsor and Stonehenge from London. First up is the magnificent royal residence of Windsor Castle, where you can admire the lavish State Rooms and walk the historic ramparts. Next, be awed by the towering monument of Stonehenge, which dates back to 2000 BC, but remains shrouded in mystery. Finally, enjoy a guided walking tour of Oxford and see the world-renowned university colleges, where notable alumni include Lewis Carroll, Oscar Wilde and Stephen Hawking.
events.name: Windsor Castle, Oxford and Stonehenge Tour from London with Lunch Pack Included

events.description: No visit to England would be complete without experiencing quintessential traditions such as the Changing of the Guard. See British culture come to life from select prime vantage points. In a small group limited to 15, observe the Queen’s iconic foot guards, clad in red tunics and bearskin hats, and watch the household cavalry put on an impressive display. Follow history-rich guide commentary with ease using a headset.
events.name: Small-Group Changing of the Guard Walking Tour

events.description: Treat yourself to a festive afternoon tea at Westminster Abbey, then board a luxury coach to see the Christmas lights of London. Set in a private room in the Cellarium Café and Terrace at Westminster Abbey, the afternoon tea is complete with turkey and smoked salmon sandwiches, gingerbread, mince pies, Christmas cake, and more. With your appetite sated, you’ll then board a coach to see the twinkling lights of London and the Norwegian Christmas tree in Trafalgar Square.
events.name: Christmas Special: Afternoon Tea at Westminster Abbey and Lights Tour

events.description: Lose yourself in England’s storybook villages as you tour the picturesque Cotswolds and the medieval town of Stratford-upon-Avon on this full-day tour from London. Walk in the footsteps of England’s most iconic playwright as you tour Shakespeare’s birthplace and Anne Hathaway’s Cottage in Stratford-upon-Avon. After tucking into a packed lunch (included), marvel at the traditional English villages, rolling hills and thatched-roof cottages of the Cotswolds, as you visit Bibury, Burford and Bourton-on-the-water.
events.name: Shakespeare's Stratford-upon-Avon and Cotswolds Tour from London with Lunch

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/26601P50/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Round Trip between London Airports and your Hotel, Smooth Arrival and Departure Transfer

events.description: Forget the stress of booking a taxi or shuttle your London-area airport. Reserve this private transfer — available 24 hours daily — for a quick and comfortable ride from your hotel in London Docklands or London City accommodation to London Heathrow, Gatwick, Stansted, Luton or City Airport. Arrive relaxed with time to spare!
events.name: Private London Departure Transfer - Hotel/Accommodation to Airport

events.description: Discover the spectacular sights of London according to your own personal itinerary on a private custom tour of the vibrant capital with a knowledgeable guide. Opt to enjoy a half- or full-day tour and customize your itinerary according to your cultural and historical interests. Allow your expert guide to pre-plan logistics like public transportation and reservations, and then delve into the capital’s rich history by listening to illuminating commentary. See iconic attractions like Big Ben and the Tower of London, and stray from the conventional tourist trail for a unique experience of London.
events.name: Private Custom Tour: London in a Day

events.description: Tangle with the macabre on a ghost bus tour through London! With your ghoulish guide, visit notorious local haunts (so to speak) of restless spirits, and pass chilling sites of murder, execution and torture such as St Paul’s Cathedral, the Tower of London and the little-known Cross Bones Graveyard. Hear fascinating facts about the London’s gruesome past and make key stops at the city’s eeriest landmarks.
events.name: The Ghost Bus Tours - London

events.description: Journey to England’s south-eastern coast on this full-day small-group tour of Dover and Canterbury from London. Drive through the scenic Kent countryside to the historic port of Dover, overlooked by the dramatic White Cliffs of Dover and enjoy free time to explore attractions like the medieval Dover Castle, war tunnels, Royal Court of Henry II and more. After lunch, head to Canterbury to visit the UNESCO-listed Canterbury Cathedral, the seat of the Church of England, then use your free time to explore attractions like St. Martin’s Church, St. Augustine’s Abbey, or The Beaney House of Art and Knowledge.
events.name: Day-Trip to Canterbury and Dover from London

events.description: Harry Potter fans don't want to miss this interactive walking tour in London. With a guide, be sorted into one of the four magical houses of Hogwarts and then go on an exploration of the city's filming locations. When booking, select your preferred time of departure and day of the week.
events.name: Interactive Harry Potter Walking Tour of London

events.description: Visit real-life ‘Downton Abbey’ filming locations on this black cab tour from London. Choose from three different itineraries, each of which is inspired by the popular TV drama, then sit back in your iconic transport and learn about Britain’s aristocracy and the fictional Crawley family as your personal driver-guide chauffeurs you from site to site. You might visit Greys Court, otherwise known as Downton Place; the Downton village of Bampton; or the stately Highclere Castle, which features as Downton Abbey itself.
events.name: Private Tour: 'Downton Abbey' Experience by Black Cab Including Downton Village, London Filming Locations or Highclere Castle

events.description: Uncover the enticing mysteries of Stonehenge and absorb the imperial majesty of Windsor on a full-day tour from London. Accompanied by a knowledgeable guide, visit the UNESCO World Heritage-listed site of Stonehenge to marvel at the prehistoric stone ring that has eluded experts for millennia. Delight in the Roman relics and Georgian architecture of Bath and see the world’s oldest occupied castle during time at Windsor Castle, an official residence of the British royal family. Receive personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour, limited to 16 people.
events.name: Small-Group Day Trip to Stonehenge, Bath and Windsor from London

events.description: Home to Liverpool F.C. since the 19th century, Anfield isn’t just a stadium—it’s an icon of British sports history. On a behind-the-scenes tour, you’ll enjoy special access to the landmark, and will walk in the footsteps of Liverpool’s most famous players. Discover the Player’s Tunnel and visit the Away Team Dressing Room, learn more from your audio headset, and enjoy admission to the LFC Story and Steven Gerrard Collection.
events.name: The LFC Stadium Tour

events.description: Sip on Champagne on a flight aboard the iconic Coca-Cola London Eye. Avoid much of the queue with your fast-track ticket, and enjoy priority boarding to a shared capsule for a standard, 30-minute flight. Then, enjoy a glass of chilled Pommery Brut Royal Champagne served by your host as you admire landmarks such as Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, and Big Ben. Your ticket includes interactive Samsung Galaxy Tab-powered guides and entry to the immersive 4D Experience to discover London using multi-sensory effects.
events.name: London Eye: Champagne Experience

events.description: Enjoy exclusive access to the inner stone circle at Stonehenge, one of England’s most mysterious and magnificent landmarks, on a full-day tour from London. Combine your intimate experience of Stonehenge with a visit to Oxford, home to the prestigious Oxford University, and Windsor Castle (entry not included), an official residence of Queen Elizabeth II.
events.name: Stonehenge Inner Circle Access Day Trip from London Including Oxford and Windsor

events.description: Visit the beautiful Cotswolds, Bath, and Oxford on this 2-day small-group tour from London. In two days, discover the handsome Georgian city of Bath, see the ancient stone circles of Avebury, drink in the quaint villages of the idyllic Cotswolds, and visit the medieval university city of Oxford, famous for its golden-stone architecture. An overnight stay in a 3-star hotel or bed and breakfast and round-trip travel in a top-of-the-range, 16-seat Mercedes mini-coach are included. Numbers are limited to 16 people, ensuring an intimate, small-group experience.
events.name: 2-Day Cotswolds, Bath and Oxford Small-Group Tour from London

events.description: Step into a wonderland of wizardry on this Harry Potter walking tour. Trek through muggle-run London to visit beloved literary and cinematic landmarks such as Diagon Alley, the Leaky Cauldron, and Platform 9¾. Along the way, enjoy Harry Potter trivia, and visit famous locations that inspired J.K. Rowling's epic book series. This is a magical tour for Harry Potter fans of all ages and a great activity for family vacations in London.
events.name: London Harry Potter Walking Tour

events.description: Maximize your time and budget on this full-day tour from London, starting with a tour of Leeds Castle, Henry VIII’s grand Tudor palace. Next, explore the medieval city of Canterbury, famous for the magnificent Canterbury Cathedral. After lunch, head to the coast to visit the mighty White Cliffs of Dover, then return to London to discover more of Britain’s maritime history in Greenwich. Then, cruise along the River Thames, past landmarks like Tower Bridge and St. Paul’s Cathedral.
events.name: Leeds Castle, Canterbury Cathedral, Dover and Greenwich from London with Lunch

events.description: Experience London’s traditional drinking scene on this afternoon pub crawl. Accompany your guide on a fun and educational tour in and around the city, where you’ll visit at least four historic pubs and taste different brews (own expense). Pop into centuries-old ale houses, see literary haunts favored by writers like Charles Dickens, and learn about local drinking culture through the ages.
events.name: Small-Group Tour: Historical Pub Walking Tour of London

events.description: Step back in time on this Stonehenge and Bath day trip from London. Travel to UNESCO-listed Stonehenge, the prehistoric stone circle on Salisbury Plain. Visit the ancient monument and the state-of-the-art visitor center independently before continuing to the spa city of Bath, famous for its hot springs and links to novelist Jane Austen. Admire the 18th-century architecture on a walking tour, and upgrade your ticket to include a visit to the Roman Baths complex.
events.name: Stonehenge and Bath Day Trip from London with Optional Roman Baths Visit

events.description: Check off London’s most famous landmarks and lesser-known sights on this private, half-day tour. Travel around the English capital in an iconic black cab and pass by the Tower of London, Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament, and other top attractions. Then, head off the beaten path in search of Henry VIII’s cowshed, Winston Churchill’s cigar chair, and other quirky sights.
events.name: Private Tour: Traditional Black Cab Tour of London's Hidden Treasures

events.description: If it’s your first time in London, tick off the city’s top attractions in style on a private 9-hour sightseeing tour. Travelling in a luxurious vehicle equipped with Wi-Fi, you’ll visit icons such as Tower Bridge, 10 Downing Street, and Trafalgar Square. In the afternoon, browse Harrods departments store and admire Kensington Palace, Hyde Park, and the Princess Diana Memorial Fountain. Hotel pickup and drop-off are included.
events.name: Private London Sightseeing by Luxury Vehicle

events.description: Uncover the secrets of England’s ancient history on a full-day tour of UNESCO-listed Stonehenge and Avebury. Ponder the mystifying landmark of Stonehenge, visit the largest stone circle in the world in Avebury and step inside the Neolithic burial tomb of West Kennet Long Barrow.
events.name: Stonehenge and Avebury Day Tour from London

events.description: Countdown to midnight on-board this spectacular New Year’s Eve dinner cruise in London. Set sail for an unforgettable 5-hour cruise through the heart of London and watch the iconic city skyline glittering with festive illuminations. Tuck into a delicious 4-course meal with wine, enjoy live entertainment and hit the dance floor as you glide down the River Thames. At the turn of midnight, sip champagne as you watch the dazzling New Year’s fireworks raining down over Big Ben and the London Eye.
events.name: 5-Hour New Year's Eve River Dinner Cruise and Fireworks Display in London

events.description: Delve into London’s rich musical history on a magical mystery tour of the capital’s rock ‘n’ roll sites. With a knowledgeable guide, tour the vibrant city in a luxury minivan and visit renowned clubs, famous hotels, and record labels associated with rock ‘n’ roll legends like The Beatles, Jimmy Page, and Bill Wyman. Receive personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour, limited to only 16 people.
events.name: London Rock Legends Small Group Tour

events.description: See real-life Harry Potter filming locations on this private, 4-hour tour of London. With your very own guide chauffeuring you around by black cab, you’ll visit spots that featured in the big-screen adaptations of JK Rowling’s best-selling books. Get up close to Gringotts Bank, drive across ‘Knight Bus Bridge,’ see the Leaky Cauldron and visit Grimmauld Place, the Ministry of Magic and more. Then, follow the same route Harry took when he flew over London on his broomstick with your included hop-on hop-off Thames River cruise ticket.
events.name: Private Tour: London Harry Potter Tour by Black Cab Including Thames River Cruise

events.description: Follow in the footsteps of the Dowager Countess of Grantham and other much-loved ‘Downton Abbey’ characters on this day trip to the hit British TV series’ most famous filming locations. Departing from London, this tour takes you into beautiful Oxfordshire, where you’ll visit Downton village, Cogges Manor Farm, and the magnificent Highclere Castle.
events.name: Downton Abbey and Highclere Castle Tour from London

events.description: Set foot on one of the country’s largest television lots, and bring Coronation Street to life, on this tour at MediaCityUK. Pick from numerous daily departure times, and set off on a guided exploration of Coronation Street’s external sets. Take selfies on Coronation Street (and on Rosamund Street and Victoria Street), learn behind-the-scenes stories about the beloved soap opera from your guide, and follow in the footsteps of your favorite characters.
events.name: Coronation Street The Tour

events.description: Save time and hassle by booking this shared transfer service from central London to Heathrow, Gatwick, or Stansted Airport. Your driver picks you up from your hotel and takes you to the airport. Unlike public transport, you only make a maximum of three stops on the way. Don't worry if you have a late-night or early-morning flight as you can book your transfer for any time of day or night.
events.name: Shared departure transfer from your London hotel to the Airport

events.description: Head to Stonehenge with a prebooked ticket in hand, and admire the UNESCO-listed stone circle and visitor center at a time that suits you. The prehistoric site is so popular that a timed-entry system is in place, and if you arrive at a busy moment you may find yourself waiting to enter. This prebooked ticket lets you select your preferred time in advance; just turn up on time and go straight in.
events.name: Stonehenge Entrance Ticket

events.description: Westminster Abbey and the Houses of Parliament are two of London’s highlight landmarks—and on this tour, you’ll have special access to both. Skip the line at Westminster Abbey and head inside the soaring church, where your guide will share facts about its royal history. Next, you’ll have the rare opportunity to explore parts of the interior of the Houses of Parliament, which is frequently off-limits to the public.
events.name: Skip the Line into Houses of Parliament & Westminster Abbey Fully-Guided Tour

events.description: Get your ticket to 'The View from The Shard' and enjoy sweeping vistas of the London cityscape. As the tallest building in Western Europe, the Shard offers panoramic views of up to 40 miles (64 km) across the capital. Take a high-speed elevator to one of the viewing decks and marvel at the sights, including great angles of main attractions like the London Eye and Tower Bridge. Complement your experience with a glass of champagne (upgrade required).
events.name: The View from The Shard Direct Entry Ticket

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/26601P51/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Transfer to the Cruise ports from your London Hotel/Accommodation

events.description: Partake in a unique sightseeing excursion with this delightful lunch cruise along the River Thames. See the best of London’s riverside attractions on a cruise from Tower Pier to Westminster. Stroll the deck, savor a delectable 2-course meal and admire great views of the London Eye, the Tower of London and more. An onboard bar offers additional drink options for spicing up your afternoon (own expense).
events.name: Thames Lunch Cruise with 2-Course Meal

events.description: See London and its surrounds your way during a private, custom tour that comes with your own personal chauffeur. Whether you want to see the icons of central London, visit landmarks such as Windsor Castle and Stonehenge, or wander the historic university grounds of Oxford, this package allows you to create your own itinerary.
events.name: Private driver to visit London, Windsor, Bath, Stonehenge or Oxford

events.description: Secure your chance to see Chelsea Football Club play at Stamford Bridge Stadium. Tickets for the games sell out fast due to limited allocations, so book early to watch the top Premier League team play at the London stadium. See the action from your seat in the upper tier of the West Stand, and kick things off with a complimentary bar before the match as well as post-match sandwich buffet. A souvenir program is also included.
events.name: Chelsea Football Match at Stamford Bridge Stadium

events.description: Delight in the quintessential charm of England on a full-day tour of Oxford, the Cotswolds, and Stratford-upon-Avon from London. With a knowledgeable guide, visit some of the country’s most popular attractions and delve into the rich history of the British Empire. Catch a glimpse of the grand buildings in the prestigious Oxford University; capture photographs during stops in two gorgeous Cotswolds villages; and visit the birthplace of iconic playwright William Shakespeare in Stratford-upon-Avon. Enjoy an intimate atmosphere on this small-group tour, limited to 16 people.
events.name: Small-Group Day Trip to Oxford,the Cotswolds and Stratford-upon-Avon from London

events.description: This year, countdown to midnight aboard the Dixie Queen, one of London’s largest passenger boats during this cruise along the Thames River. Enjoy a sparkling wine reception before you indulge in a holiday buffet dinner. Then, take in views from the spacious indoor windows or outdoor open-air deck, or hit the dance floor to boogie to music played by a live band. When the new year approaches, pass under the illuminated Tower Bridge right at midnight.
events.name: New Year's Eve Cruise on the Dixie Queen

events.description: Explore Britain’s royal history on this 5.5-hour trip to Windsor Castle from London. Journey west by air-conditioned coach to the town of Windsor, and head inside Windsor Castle, the world’s oldest occupied castle, to explore independently. See highlights such as the State Apartments and St. George’s Chapel  — the burial place of 10 sovereigns, including Henry VIII — and enjoy free time to amble around Windsor town. Return to London and finish with a British lunch at the St. George's Tavern in Victoria.
events.name: Windsor Castle Tour from London with Lunch

events.description: London’s British Museum is home to a staggering collection of 8 million items, some dating as far back as the prehistoric age. Make sure you see the best of this British Museum by taking this private 2 to 2.5-hour tour of the cultural institution. Alongside an engaging tour guide, you’ll visit a curated section of cultural and artistic works that represent the diversity of the museum’s collection: see samurai armor, the Rosetta Stone and 2 million year-old tools. This private tour gives you the chance to customize your itinerary according to your interests.
events.name: The British Museum London Guided Tour - Private Tour

events.description: Experience the world of wizardry on a tour of London's Harry Potter filming locations. Cruise through the city by coach to visit cinematic landmarks such as Number 12, Grimmauld Place, Diagon Alley and Platform 9¾. Along the way, enjoy insider stories about the making of the Harry Potter films and visit famous locations that inspired the epic series.
events.name: Harry Potter Film Location Bus Tour of London

events.description: Follow in the footsteps of Harry Potter and other characters from the Harry Potter movies on this private London cab tour! Settle into a private black taxi with your own Harry Potter-expert driver as your guide, and visit a host of locations used in different Harry Potter films, including Harry Potter and the Order of Phoenix. See Diagon Alley, the Knight Bus bridge, Platform 9¾, and many other spellbinding sites as your driver recounts fascinating Potter trivia. Each taxi seats up to five passengers for the same fixed price.
events.name: Private Tour: Harry Potter Black Taxi Tour of London

events.description: Immerse yourself in the wonderful world of marine life right in the middle of London. Head to Sea Life London Aquarium. Explore the 50 colorful displays, home to over 400 species of sea creatures including sharks, eels, clownfish, octopus, and penguins. Catch an exciting live feeding, and see the new Rainforest Adventure exhibit which showcases one of the Amazon's most impressive carnivorous fish, the piranha.
events.name: SEA LIFE London Aquarium Admission Ticket

events.description: Experience the enchantment of London after hours on a night sightseeing tour. Aboard a double-decker bus, take a 1.5-hour trip through the city to see illuminated attractions like Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament and the London Eye. Hear fascinating facts about passing sites and insider tips on where to visit in the bustling capital city from your expert guide.
events.name: London Night Sightseeing Tour

events.description: Follow in the footsteps of legends like Sir Isaac Newton, C.S.Lewis and John Harvard on a full-day tour of the university city of Cambridge from London. Kick off your visit with a guided sightseeing tour and a view of the city from the Tower of Saint Mary the Great, then head off on your own to explore further. Tour the prestigious university colleges and Botanic Garden, visit the Fitzwilliam Museum or sample regional specialties at the Cambridge Market, before traveling back to London.
events.name: Cambridge Day Trip from London

events.description: See London’s Christmas lights in style on this private tour by black cab. Cruise past top London sights and jump out for a stroll down the city's bustling shopping streets. Marvel at glitzy illuminations, twinkling lights, and extravagantly decorated shop windows in upmarket neighborhoods such as Belgravia and Chelsea, and see the iconic Oxford Street Christmas light displays. Receive undivided attention from your guide on this private tour.
events.name: Private Tour: Traditional Black Cab Tour of London’s Christmas Lights

events.description: Explore 5 of London's fascinating attractions with the BIG London Attraction Ticket. Valid for up to a month, this ticket allows you to visit these 5 attractions on your own time. The ticket is valid for the DreamWorks Tours Shrek's Adventure, The Coca-Cola London Eye, the SEA LIFE London Aquarium, London Dungeon, and the iconic Madam Tussauds wax museum. Between these 5 experiences, spend some time as an ogre, see London from the top of the world's largest observation wheel, and get close to a rich array of sea life.
events.name: Magical London Pass Including Madame Tussauds London, The London Eye, SEA LIFE London, The London Dungeon and Shrek’s Adventure! London

events.description: Avoid looking conspicuously like a tourist by traveling around London like a local: in a black cab. This private tour transports you around the capital in style, taking in such sights as St. Pauls, the Tower of London, Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey, and Buckingham Palace, as well as a few lesser-known spots missed by most tourists.
events.name: Bespoke Private Tour of London in an iconic London 'Black Cab'

events.description: Lose yourself in the crime-busting, mystery-solving world of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson on this private walking tour of London. Visit the home of the legendary detective at 221B Baker Street; see fiction brought to life in the Sherlock Holmes Museum and shop for Sherlock souvenirs at the official Sherlock Holmes Store. Then, follow the trail of BBC TV series Sherlock as you visit memorable filming locations in Russell Square and Whitehall; see the site of Sherlock's fake death and hear stories about Sherlock actors Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman.
events.name: Private Sherlock Holmes Walking Tour in London

events.description: Follow in the footsteps of one of Britain’s most celebrated Prime Ministers and historic figures on this private, Winston Churchill-themed walking tour. Following pickup from your hotel or another convenient meeting point, you’ll explore the areas of Mayfair, Westminster, and Piccadilly associated with Churchill, from his childhood home and 10 Downing Street to the cigar shop he once frequented. Your final stop is at the Churchill War Rooms, the secret bunker from which he ran World War II.
events.name: Sir Winston Churchill Private Walking Tour & War Rooms

events.description: Delve into the rich cultural tapestry of England on a fulfilling full-day trip to Blenheim Palace and the Cotswolds from London. With an accomplished guide, explore the opulent chambers of Blenheim Palace, a Baroque manor house that boasts UNESCO World Heritage status, and discover the building's historical heritage. Travel to the Cotswolds to absorb the splendor of an area replete with charming churches and gorgeous natural panoramas including Bourton-on-the-Water and Bampton, to see filming locations for 'Downton Abbey.'
events.name: Blenheim Palace Tour and The Cotswolds Custom Day Trip from London

events.description: See the world’s leading tribute to the BBC’s Fawlty Towers TV series at Faulty Towers The Dining Experience, two hours of brilliant fun in the heart of London’s theater land. Head to the Radisson Blu Edwardian Bloomsbury Hotel and enjoy a unique theatrical script, lightning-quick improvisation, and a 3-course lunch or dinner – not to mention shocking service and hilarious theatrical scenes.
events.name: Faulty Towers The Dining Experience

events.description: Enjoy one of the most epic musicals on stage with a ticket to the ‘The Lion King’ at London’s Lyceum Theatre. An adaptation of Disney’s hit 1994 film, the show tells the story of young lion Simba as he fights to reclaim his place as King of the Pridelands. Set against the plains of Africa, and exploding with color, effects, and songs by Tim Rice and Elton John, the show thrills adults and children alike. Make the evening extra memorable when you upgrade to include a mouth-watering pre-show dinner.
events.name: The Lion King Theater Show

events.description: Glide by some of London’s must-see landmarks on a sightseeing cruise from Westminster to Greenwich on the River Thames. Step aboard your comfortable cruise boat at Westminster Pier and listen to the entertaining live commentary as you pass sights such as Shakespeare’s Globe, Tower Bridge, and the Tower of London. Drink in the views from the open or indoor deck, and at Greenwich, step ashore to visit attractions (own expense) such as the Cutty Sark or National Maritime Museum. Upgrade to include a return cruise back to Westminster.
events.name: Westminster to Greenwich Sightseeing Thames Cruise

events.description: Follow in the footsteps of the greats on this full-day tour of England’s most famous university cities – Oxford and Cambridge. Admire the celebrated ‘Dreaming Spires’ of Oxford and visit the Bodleian Library and Christ Church College, where alumni include Lewis Carroll, Bill Clinton and David Cameron, and the Great Hall was used as a filming location for the Harry Potter movies. Next, journey to prestigious Cambridge, where past students include Sir Isaac Newton, Stephen Hawking and Sylvia Plath, and architectural highlights include the Cavendish Laboratory, King’s College Chapel and the Cambridge University Library.
events.name: Oxford and Cambridge Tour from London with Free Lunch Pack

events.description: Discover the sights and history of London from the water on this leisurely cruise down the River Thames. With your 24-hour pass, enjoy unobstructed views of the city’s main riverside attractions like the London Eye and the Houses of Parliament from within an all-weather vessel, and hop on or off at any stop along the way. Create your own London adventure.
events.name: Thames Hop-On Hop-Off River Cruise

events.description: Witness the enchantment of London at night with a two-hour evening cruise along the historic River Thames! Aboard the glass-encased boat, enjoy the city’s main attractions at dusk, including the Shard, Big Ben and the Cutty Sark ship. Savor sparkling wine and canapés as you cruise the river and delight in the magic of London’s urban shoreline as night falls.
events.name: River Thames Evening Cruise

events.description: Enter the world of Harry Potter™ when you’re in London at the Warner Bros. Studio Tour London. With convenient transportation from the city to the studio, this Harry Potter tour introduces you to all the details that went into the making of the magical movies, including film sets, props, costumes and special effects. Stand in the Great Hall, walk along Diagon Alley, see Dumbledore’s office and more. Select a departure time when booking.
events.name: Warner Bros. Studio Tour London - The Making of Harry Potter with Transportation

events.description: When your cruise concludes in the city of Southampton, discover the delights of the English countryside on a post-shore excursion to London via Salisbury, Stonehenge, and Windsor. With a knowledgeable guide, experience must-see attractions like the medieval Salisbury Cathedral and the mysterious stone ring of Stonehenge. Visit the quintessential town of Windsor to see the world’s oldest occupied castle and then travel directly to your London hotel in a comfortable, air-conditioned coach.
events.name: Southampton: Post-Cruise Tour to London via Salisbury, Stonehenge and Windsor

events.description: Take a break from bustling London and spend an exciting and enriching day at Windsor Castle. The impressive structure has been called home by British monarchs since the 11th century and is a weekend favorite of Queen Elizabeth. You’re free to explore the grounds at your own pace and only focus on the spots that interest you. Visit the State Apartments, St. George's Chapel, Queen Mary's Doll House, and more.
events.name: Windsor Castle Admission Ticket

events.description: Make your visit to the Warner Bros. Studio Tour seamless on a full-day tour that includes round-trip transportation from central London. Skip the hassle of figuring out your way there; relax on the luxury coach during the journey from King's Cross St. Pancras station. Ticket included for a half-day visit to The Making of Harry Potter.
events.name: Warner Bros. Studio Tour London- The Making of Harry Potter (from King's Cross)

events.description: Immerse yourself in the rich history of World War II on an enriching and emotionally stirring tour of London Westminster with a knowledgeable guide. Descend to the subterranean Churchill War Rooms, an underground network of bunkers that functioned as wartime offices, and enrich your knowledge of British history with commentary that covers little known facts. As you explore, see iconic London sights like the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben, and delve into the life and work of former British prime minister, Winston Churchill.
events.name: Historical London Walking Tour in Westminster & Entry to Churchill War Rooms

events.description: Let your adrenaline levels go through the roof during a white-knuckle ride on the Thames River. Climb aboard a modern RIB (rigid-inflatable-boat) and satisfy an appetite for adventure as you soar past iconic landmarks like Big Ben, St Paul’s Cathedral and the London Eye. Enrich your knowledge of English history as you listen to illuminating onboard commentary, and experience the exhilaration of super-fast speeds up to 35 miles (56 km). Enjoy an intimate atmosphere on this small-group tour, limited to 12 people.
events.name: High-Speed Thames River RIB Cruise in London

events.description: Add an element of surprise to your trip on this Bath and Stonehenge day trip from London, including a visit to a secret, off-the-beaten-track attraction only revealed on the day. Join an optional walking tour of Bath or explore the UNESCO-listed city at your own pace, visiting sights like the Roman Baths, the Jane Austen Centre, Bath Abbey and the Royal Crescent. Finally, stop off at ancient Stonehenge and snap photos of the magnetic stone circle while learning all about the site’s mysterious origins.
events.name: Small Group Stonehenge, Bath and Secret Place Tour from London

events.description: Sample the best of the British countryside as you visit a lavish private estate and a traditional English country village on this full-day tour from London. Start your adventure with a guided tour of the opulent Blenheim Palace, where you can peek into the state rooms and stroll around the magnificent gardens, designed by Capability Brown. Next, continue to the heart of the Cotswolds and stop to see the timber-fronted houses of Burford village, explore the market town of Stow-on-the-Wold and stroll the idyllic waterways of Bourton-on-the-Water.
events.name: Blenheim Palace, Cotswolds and Oxford Tour from London with Admission & Lunch

events.description: See London’s signature sights by vintage Routemaster bus and Thames River cruise on this sightseeing tour. Board a retro, red double-decker bus London Routemaster, and enjoy stellar views of top London attractions including the Tower of London, St. Paul’s Cathedral, and Westminster Abbey. Then, after a short Thames sightseeing cruise, ride your London double-decker to Buckingham Palace for a photo stop or to witness the colorful Changing of the Guard ceremony. If you wish, upgrade to add a visit to the London Eye, Tower of London, or UNESCO-listed Stonehenge after your tour.
events.name: Vintage London Bus Tour Including Thames Cruise with Optional London Eye

events.description: Ideal for travelers looking to escape the city, this tour takes you to the quaint villages of the Cotswolds, an ‘Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty’ characterized by rural landscapes and limestone houses. Departing London on a private vehicle equipped with Wi-Fi, you’ll stroll around the villages of Burford, Stow-on-the-Wold, Bourton-on-the-Water, Lower Slaughter, and Yanworth. Snacks and hotel pickup and drop-off are included.
events.name: Private Cotswold Villages from London: Burford, Stow-on-the-Wold

events.description: Feel your spine tingle as you follow in the footsteps of violent murderers like Jack the Ripper and Sweeney Todd on a ghoulish ghost coach-and-walking tour of London. See the sinister side of the city as you creep down gas-lit alleys and secluded streets to discover London’s gory history; travel by motor coach between destinations and listen to terrifying tales told by an entertaining guide. Absorb the eerie atmosphere of Whitechapel Road, where gruesome murders took place in the 19th century; hear tales of barbaric barber Sweeney Todd as you arrive at his former residence in Fleet Street; and visit the sinister sites of Jack the Ripper murders on this truly terrifying tour.
events.name: Jack the Ripper and Haunted London Tour

events.description: Drive through the idyllic Cotswolds countryside on a full-day tour by luxury air-conditioned coach and visit some of England’s most quintessential attractions. Discover the majestic ‘Dreaming Spires’ of Oxford, one of the world’s most famous university cities, on a walking tour, then pay a visit to the birthplace of William Shakespeare at Stratford-Upon-Avon. Finally, immerse yourself in the fully interactive medieval exhibitions at Warwick Castle.
events.name: Oxford, Stratford, Cotswolds & Warwick Castle Tour from London with Lunch Pack

events.description: Visit some of England’s top destinations outside London on a day trip to the Cotswolds, the university city of Oxford, and the town of Stratford-upon-Avon, the birthplace of William Shakespeare. When you reach Oxford, visit sights like Christchurch College and the Bridge of Sighs before heading to Stratford-upon-Avon where you have free time to explore.
events.name: Oxford, Stratford Upon Avon and Cotswolds Tour from London

events.description: Visit six of London’s biggest attractions with one ticket usable across 90 days. Get aerial views of the city on the London Eye; take a sightseeing cruise along the River Thames; hang out with your favorite celebrities at Madame Tussauds; take the Shrek’s Adventure! Tour to explore the DreamWorks animated movie; discover marine life at SEA LIFE Aquarium; step into the London Dungeon for an interactive retelling of London’s history.
events.name: Big Adventures 6 Attraction Ticket Including Madame Tussauds, SEA LIFE Aquarium, London Eye, Shrek's Adventure! London and The London Dungeon

events.description: Unravel the truths and myths of London’s most notorious serial killer on this 2.5-hour Jack the Ripper walking tour with a twist. Follow your guide and small-group around the notorious streets of the East End, Jack the Ripper’s one-time stomping ground, stopping along the way to sample Happy Hour specialties. Sip old-fashioned London Gin in Whitechapel, enjoy wine tasting at Spitalfields' market, then head to Brick Lane for bagels and local craft beer.
events.name: The Jack The Ripper Happy Hour Tasting Tour

events.description: Enjoy a hassle-free, exclusive arrival in London with this executive private transfer service. Meet your driver at London Heathrow, Gatwick, Stansted, Luton, or London City Airport, and relax on the journey to your London hotel or private residence. These private vehicles can accommodate up to eight passengers.
events.name: Executive Private London Arrival Transfer - Airport to Hotel/Accommodation

events.description: See London from the streets, water, and sky with this great-value package that lets you explore London at your own pace. Easily reach top sights without spending a fortune on cab fare with a hop-on hop-off bus ticket valid for 1, 2, or 3 days. You’ll also get an aerial view of the city aboard of the London Eye giant observation wheel and glide past Parliament and Big Ben on a Thames River cruise.
events.name: The London Eye with London Hop-on Hop-Off Tour and River Cruise

events.description: Escape the bustle of England’s capital and experience the beauty of Cornwall and the Cotswolds on a 5-day tour that eliminates the need for advance planning. A guide takes care of arranging all accommodation, activities, and transfers so you don’t have to, and provides personalized attention to your small group.
events.name: Cornwall & the Cotswolds: Small-Group Tour from London (5-days)

events.description: Journey through London’s darkest days with an entrance ticket to the London Dungeon. This chilling sensory experience includes elaborate staging, interactive attractions, and engaging performances. Witness gruesome scenes including the horrors of London’s notorious killers, the putrescence of the Great Plague, and the Great Fire of 1666. The stout of heart may choose to step into the shoes of a victim on the gallows on 'Drop Dead: Drop Ride!'
events.name: The London Dungeon Standard Ticket

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/17972P161/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Transfer: Central London to Southampton Cruise Port

events.description: Escape the city in favor of England’s tranquil countryside on a full-day tour of Canterbury, Leeds Castle, and Dover from London. Tailored to the interests of history buffs, this excursion covers the history-rich city of Canterbury, home to the 6th-century Canterbury Cathedral, and the iconic White Cliffs of Dover. See, too, the charming Leeds Castle, surrounded by lakes and verdant gardens.
events.name: Canterbury, Leeds Castle, and Dover in One Day from London

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/59254P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Cotswolds and Stratford upon Avon

events.description: Absorb the majesty of England’s historical and cultural treasures on a customizable full-day tour of Warwick Castle, Oxford, the Cotswolds and Stratford-upon-Avon from London. Alongside a knowledgeable guide, delve into the rich history of ancient landmarks like Warwick Castle; get acquainted with Shakespeare’s hometown in Stratford-upon-Avon; absorb the natural splendor of the Cotswolds; and see the prestigious university buildings of Oxford. Relish the flexibility of this tour by customizing the day according to your interests. Upgrade to include entrance fees, or enjoy the flexibility of deciding on the day which attractions you'd like to visit.
events.name: Warwick Castle, Oxford, Cotswolds, and Stratford-upon-Avon Custom Day Trip

events.description: Visit the Churchill War Rooms, part of London’s Imperial War Museum and learn about the life and legacy of Sir Winston Churchill. Leading Britain to victory in World War II, the former prime minister made use of a wartime bunker beneath the streets of Westminster. Use your entrance ticket to explore the historic rooms at your leisure, and visit the on-site Churchill Museum where multimedia exhibits bring the story of the great leader to life.
events.name: Churchill War Rooms Entrance Ticket

events.description: Celebrate 2020 right from the start with a New Year’s Eve dinner at The Listing and a cruise along the Thames. After a welcome glass of bubbly at the restaurant, tuck in to a 3-course dinner, which includes half a bottle of wine per person. Continue your evening with a cruise along the River Thames for unparalleled views of the city and of the annual fireworks over the London Eye.
events.name: New Year's Eve Dinner at The Listing and Cruise on the Moon Clipper

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/3395P53/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: 5 Day Best of the Lake District Experience Tour

events.description: Experience the world’s longest-running West End musical with tickets to the London 'Les Misérables' at the Queen’s Theatre. Based on the incredible novel by Victor Hugo, this award-laden musical tells the tale of Jean Valjean, a fugitive in 19th-century France. A story of passion, courage, redemption, and the indomitability of the human spirit, the show enthralls and uplifts you with songs such as ‘I Dreamed a Dream,’ and others. Opt for standard or top-price seats, and upgrade to enjoy a 3-course pre-show dinner at a charming theater-district restaurant.
events.name: Les Miserables Theater Show

events.description: Hop on a train to the north of England and discover the hometown of the Beatles on this full-day independent day trip to Liverpool. Swot up on Fab Four facts and experience modern-day Beatlemania at the award-winning Beatles Story, then ride the Magical Mystery Bus Tour and visit sights like ‘Penny Lane’ and ‘Strawberry Field.' Use your free time to check out Liverpool’s UNESCO-listed Waterfront, and visit the museums and restaurants of Albert Dock, then finish with a drink at the legendary Cavern Club music venue.
events.name: Independent Beatles Day Trip to Liverpool from London by Train

events.description: Maximize your time in Liverpool with a hop-on hop-off sightseeing cruise along the Mersey River. Aboard a colorful ‘dazzle ferry,’ pass main city attractions and disembark at any of the port stops to check out the sites up close. Admission to the U-Boat Story for a look at an authentic WWII German submarine is included. Upgrade your tour to include entry to Spaceport, an interactive space center.
events.name: Liverpool: 50-Minute Mersey River Cruise

events.description: Visit Oxford and top Downton Abbey filming locations on this day trip from London. Start the day with a walking tour of Oxford and its famous university buildings, and then continue to the Cotswolds’ village of Bampton, which is also known as Downton village in the award-winning British TV series. Visit the magnificent Highclere Castle, known in the show as Downton Abbey, in Hampshire. Upgrade to include a signed copy of “Entertaining at The Real Downtown Abbey” book written by Lady Carnarvon.
events.name: Downton Abbey and Oxford Tour from London Including Highclere Castle

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/137859P6/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Tour to Stonehenge, Bath and The Cotswolds

events.description: Trade London’s bustle for a day in the scenic English countryside on this immersive coach tour. Depart in the morning from Victoria Coach Station, and travel first to Leeds Castle: a 900-year-old landmark that’s among Britain’s loveliest castles. Next, head to Canterbury to view the Canterbury Cathedral: a UNESCO-listed architectural wonder that’s also the seat of the Archbishop of Canterbury. Finally, see the White Cliffs of Dover: another English icon. Admission also includes access to a hop-on hop-off London bus tour.
events.name: Leeds Castle, Canterbury Cathedral & Dover with London Hop-on-Hop-off tour

events.description: Go back to London's Middle Ages with dinner and entertainment at Medieval Banquet. During this evening experience, you'll join King Henry VIII and his court at a royal banquet near the Tower of London for a medieval-style dinner theater. Enjoy a 4-course dinner with drinks, and watch court jesters, fighting knights, acrobats, musicians, and dancers.
events.name: Medieval Banquet- Interactive show, 4 Course meal,Ale and wine with Dinner,Disco

events.description: Sightsee in London by vintage double-decker bus and modern catamaran on this half-day tour. As you travel around the city, watch out for top London landmarks like Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. Then, hop out for photos at the Tower of London before taking a cruise along the Thames River. Sparkling wine, cream tea with scones at Harrods, and scones complete the experience.
events.name: London Vintage Bus Tour with Cream Tea at Harrods

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/195542P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Half Day London Tour With Car/Black Cab/MPV/Van/Coach

events.description: Legendary churches, UNESCO World Heritage sites and other famous landmarks await you on this day trip from London. Discover Leeds Castle before it opens to the public during a private, guided visit; snap photos of the striking White Cliffs of Dover; tour Canterbury Cathedral, immortalized by Geoffrey Chaucer in ‘The Canterbury Tales'; explore the beautiful borough of Greenwich; and take in London’s world-famous sights on a sunset cruise along the Thames River.
events.name: Early Access Leeds Castle, Canterbury Cathedral, and Greenwich from London

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/29076P7/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Round Transfer from Heathrow Airport to London City

events.description: Soak up the electric atmosphere of Soho by night with an after-hours food tour of London’s nightlife hub. Follow your guide, a fellow foodie, to little known cafés, restaurants and local haunts for a real taste of London’s international food scene. Along the way, sample everything from Spanish Jamón to Chinese dumplings, and get the inside scoop on the best places to eat, drink and party in Soho.
events.name: Evening Food Tour of Soho in London

events.description: Enhance your experience of one of England’s most iconic landmarks on a tour of Stonehenge that begins in London and concludes in Southampton. Depart from London in a luxury vehicle and delve into the atmospheric mystery of Stonehenge, a UNESCO-listed ancient stone circle, before boarding your cruise ship at Southampton’s port. Absorb the majesty of the Stonehenge independently and enjoy a hassle-free transfer to your cruise port on this compelling and convenient tour.
events.name: Southampton Excursion: Pre-Cruise Tour from London to Southampton via Stonehenge

events.description: Discover the best sites in England and Wales, on this small-group tour from London. Save hours researching and planning your trip, and instead have it all organized for you. Your trip will be enriched by having a guide to give historical information on the places you visit. Highlights include Lulworth Cove, The Jurassic Coast, Land’s End, Cornwall, Cotswold’s Villages, Wales, York, and Oxford. A magical tour around the UK.
events.name: Best of England and Wales 9 day (Small Group) tour from London

events.description: Cover three of England’s most iconic attractions on this private, chauffeured trip to Windsor Castle, Stonehenge, and Bath. Travel comfortably between locations in your own luxurious, climate-controlled Mercedes, with door-to-door hotel pickup and drop-off. Step inside the historic chapel where Prince Harry wed Meghan Markle, marvel at towering, thousands-year-old Neolithic monuments, and explore Roman and Georgian influences in Britain’s famous spa town.
events.name: Windsor, Stonehenge & Bath Private Car Tour

events.description: Plan your own itinerary in Dublin with this independent 4 Day tour from London, including hotel accommodations and all transportation. Travel by train and cruise-ferry to the city center. Spend your time how you’d like, with main spots, such as the Guinness Storehouse, Kilmainham Gaol , Old Jameson Distillery, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, and the Book of Kels exhibit at Trinity College all close by.
events.name: Dublin Independent 4-Day Rail Tour from London

events.description: Combine two classic Cambridge experiences into one tour—a walking tour of Cambridge University and a punting cruise along the Cam River. First, embark on a tour of the prestigious university colleges and get an insight into student life from your Cambridge University graduate guide. After admiring architectural highlights like King’s College, Trinity College, and The Senate House, hop aboard a traditional punt for a cruise. As you glide along the river banks, enjoy unbeatable views of The Backs, the picturesque parks, and colleges that line the waterfront.
events.name: Combo Ticket: Punting and Student-Guided Walking Tour of Cambridge University

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/160852P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private London Landmarks by Car

events.description: Leave London for a day at the UNESCO-listed White Cliffs of Dover and Canterbury. Making a trip to the county of Kent easy, the excursion includes a guide plus round-trip transport from easy-to-find locations in central London. Unlike many day trips to Kent, you’ll have the choice of how you spend your morning. Walk along the National Trust trails at the famous white cliffs or opt for a quick photo stop before you visit Dover Castle (own expense). Later, you’ll see Canterbury and its striking cathedral.
events.name: White Cliffs of Dover, Canterbury & Kent Coast Day Tour

events.description: Get to know Liverpool and discover the home of the Beatles with this hop-on hop-off bus pass valid for 48 hours. Enjoy unlimited access to two different routes—the Blue Route, which follows a Beatles-themed itinerary, visiting Penny Lane, Strawberry Field and the childhood homes on John Lennon and Paul McCartney; and the Red Route, which stops at city attractions including Royal Albert Dock, the Walker Gallery, the Cavern Club, and Liverpool Cathedral.
events.name: City & Beatles Tour - BLUE ROUTE

events.description: The British Museum in London houses around eight million artifacts, making it difficult to sift out the must-sees on a first-time or short visit. This small-group tour does the work for you, with a guide to show you around some carefully curated highlights. View important pieces such as the Mummy of Katebet, Lewis Chessmen, and more, as you uncover their significance and history. Entrance to the British Museum is free.
events.name: The British Museum London Guided Tour - Semi-Private 8ppl Max

events.description: Enjoy a day in beautiful Paris as you wish on this great-value, unescorted Eurostar rail day trip from London. Ride the morning Eurostar to Paris and get the whole day to enjoy the city at your leisure. Perhaps visit the Eiffel Tower and Ile de la Cité, stroll along the Champs-Élysées, explore the magnificent Louvre, and dip into the sidewalk cafes and chic boutiques—it’s your choice. Your experience includes round-trip Eurostar standard class tickets, maps, and a Visite Paris Pass giving you unlimited, 1-day use of Paris’ metro and bus network.
events.name: Budget Independent Rail Tour to Paris by Eurostar

events.description: Explore two of England’s most famous UNESCO World heritage sites on this private full-day tour from London. Visit historic Bath, where you can admire the Georgian architecture along the Royal Crescent, peek into the legendary Roman Baths and Pump Room, and enjoy free time to browse the shops. Then, discover the mysteries of ancient Stonehenge as you marvel over the stone circle and learn more about its origins at the Stonehenge Visitor Centre.
events.name: Private Full-Day Tour of Bath and Stonehenge from London

events.description: Experience the electric atmosphere of an English football (soccer) game at an Arsenal match in North London. Watch the sporting action unravel from one of the best seats in the house and see talented premiership footballers showcase their skills on the pitch. Hear the pulsating roar of Arsenal fans when a skilled goad is scored, and then explore the intriguing exhibits of the Arsenal Museum after the match has finished. With your ticket, enjoy complimentary halftime refreshments, a match program and a non-match-day guided tour of the stadium.
events.name: Arsenal Football Match at Emirates Stadium

events.description: Experience some of the highlights of the Lake District National Park on this full-day Ten Lakes Spectacular small-group tour from Windermere. Traveling by air-conditioned minivan with an expert guide, explore the beauty spots and villages of central Lakeland as you learn about its history. Ascend high mountain passes, visit a waterfall, take a sightseeing cruise, and see ten of the most beautiful lakes, including Buttermere and Thirlmere. Discover Borrowdale and quaint villages such as Grasmere; visit Castlerigg Stone Circle; and enjoy free time for lunch in the market town of Keswick.
events.name: Ten Lakes Tour of the Lake District from Windermere

events.description: Book a shared arrival transfer from London Heathrow, Gatwick or Stansted Airport to your London City hotel, and enjoy a stress-free start to your trip. It’s a simple, cost-effective option that’s available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Transport is by comfortable bus.
events.name: Shared London Arrival Transfer - Airport to Hotel/Accommodation

events.description: This Harry Potter combo experience provides two activities in one day for an in-depth look at the beloved wizarding movies: a film locations tour in London and admission for the Warner Bros. Studio Tour London – The Making of Harry Potter. On the film locations tour, a guide shows you London sites that played a role in the movies. Then head to the Warner Bros. studio with provided coach transportation for more movie magic.
events.name: The Ultimate Harry Potter Experience

events.description: Experience the thrill and spectacle of the wild kingdom right in the middle of London. Head to ZSL London Zoo—a favorite attraction of Charles Darwin––with this admission ticket. Spend hours exploring the vibrant habitat displays such as Penguin Beach, Gorilla Kingdom, and Tiger Territory. Visit more than 20 themed animal enclosures and catch a live talk or feeding.
events.name: London Zoo Entry Ticket

events.description: Feast your senses on the cosmopolitan culinary scene of East London during a 3.5-hour walking tour of the vibrant London district. Accompanied by an expert gastronome guide, explore the eclectic neighborhoods of Spitalfields and Shoreditch to discover spots favored by local food-lovers. Appease your appetite with the English classic of a bacon sandwich at St John Bread and Wine restaurant; delight in the complex flavors of Beigel Bake's delectable salt beef bagels; and savor creamy artisan cheese during a tasting session. Stroll the renowned Brick Lane to sample spicy curries and try the traditional British dish, fish and chips, at Poppies restaurant.
events.name: London East End Food Tour

events.description: The Tower of London is steeped in rich history dating back more than 850 years. Explore the castle with a beefeater (also known as a Yoeman Warder) who knows the castle and its history better than normal tour guides do. Morning start times for this Tower of London tour allow you to enter the tower among some of the day’s very first visitors, and your private group audience with the beefeater allows you to get your questions answered.
events.name: Private Audience with Beefeater at The Tower of London

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/59254P6/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private guided tour london

events.description: Combine in-depth tours of Bath and Windsor Castle with personalized attention on this full-day private tour. You'll enjoy being able to customize your itinerary and ask plenty of questions along the way. Your guide will provide insightful commentary on the history, architecture, and culture of the sights.
events.name: Private Day Tour to Bath and Windsor Castle

events.description: See London’s most spectacular sights on a bus tour of England’s cultural capital. Listen to commentary from a guide as you explore the city by coach and foot. See the dome of St Paul’s Cathedral, learn the history behind of the Tower of London, and admire the colossal skyscrapers of the City of London. Even better, the experience includes a ticket for a one-way River Thames sightseeing cruise to be used on the day or another time.
events.name: London City Sightseeing Tour Including Tower of London and City of London

events.description: See Stonehenge before the crowds arrive—and even have time for additional sightseeing afterwards—on this seamless, half-day tour from London. Don’t worry about finding your own way on public transportation: depart early in the morning from London Victoria, and arrive at the UNESCO World Heritage Site before most of the crowds. Admission and shuttle bus tickets are included, as are audio headsets. Explore the world-famous landmark at your own pace before returning to London by mid-afternoon.
events.name: Stonehenge Morning Half Day Tour Including Admission

events.description: Combine London’s legendary sights with a scrumptious English tea on this Thames River afternoon sightseeing cruise. Sail by top London attractions such as Big Ben, the London Eye and Tower of London, and enjoy stellar views of The Shard, the ‘Gherkin’ building, and other icons. As you cruise, savor a delicious afternoon tea of dainty sandwiches and cakes, plus scones with clotted cream and preserves, accompanied by teas and coffees.
events.name: London Thames River Afternoon Tea Cruise

events.description: Secure your spot at the Tina Turner theatre show, one of the most highly-anticipated shows to hit the West End, by booking your ticket in advance. Follow the story of Tina Turner’s humble beginning in Tennessee to her status as queen of rock’n’roll during this high-octane stage show, which features many well-known songs. Three seating options and a pre-theater dinner upgrade are available.
events.name: Tina Turner Theater Show in London

events.description: Make Boxing Day extra special with this full-day tour of Windsor, Stonehenge, Bath and Lacock from London. On December 26, travel by air-conditioned coach to see Windsor Castle, the picturebook medieval castle in Windsor still used by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. Next, visit spectacular, prehistoric UNESCO-listed Stonehenge and enjoy an English pub lunch, before continuing to 13th-century Lacock. Admire this quintessential English village, and then finish with a coach and walking tour of handsome, Georgian-era Bath to see top Bath attractions including the Royal Crescent and Pulteney Bridge.
events.name: Boxing Day Tour from London: Windsor, Stonehenge, Bath and Lacock Including Lunch

events.description: When your cruise concludes, maximize your time in southern England on a comprehensive tour of Bath and Windsor. Departing Southampton and concluding in London, this full-day shore excursion with an optional visit to Bath’s Roman Baths and the Jane Austen Centre (both extra cost), and stops in Royal Windsor for sights of the famed castle and a chance to explore the surrounding town. Enjoy a hotel drop-off at Heathrow Airport or Central London.
events.name: Southampton - London Transfer with a Visit to Bath and Windsor

events.description: Walk the halls of one of the world’s oldest and most famous universities on this walking tour of Oxford University. Get a glimpse of student life as you peek inside the famous Bodleian Library and see landmarks like the University Church of St Mary, the Bridge of Sighs and Trinity College. Learn about the prestigious university’s famous alumni, hear fascinating stories and anecdotes about its history, and see on-campus locations used in the Harry Potter films.
events.name: Oxford University Walking Tour

events.description: London's Madame Tussauds is a hugely popular attraction that draws large numbers of visitors daily. Skip the lines to get in with a Premium Ticket, which also includes entry to the Sherlock Holmes Experience and complimentary popcorn to enjoy during the Marvel 4D Experience.
events.name: Madame Tussauds London - Premium Ticket

events.description: Get up close and personal with one of London’s most beautiful and historically significant landmarks when you book tickets to St. Paul’s Cathedral. Designed by Sir Christopher Wren in the 17th century, the landmark is renowned for it soaring dome, and has hosted royal weddings and Diamond Jubilee celebrations. You’ll explore the interior, can ascend to the Whispering Gallery, Stone Gallery, and Golden Gallery (the latter of which offers panoramic views over London), and even visit the crypt.
events.name: St Paul's Cathedral Admission Ticket

events.description: Discover two of London’s most famous sights on this private walking tour. With an expert guide who specializes in art history, you’ll visit the Tower of London, one of Europe’s best-preserved medieval fortresses in the heart of the City of London, and Tower Bridge.
events.name: Private Tour: London Walking Tour of the Tower of London and Tower Bridge

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/9098P14/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Chauffeured Vehicle to Stonehenge from London

events.description: Delight in the regal majesty of royal London on a private half- or full-day tour by black cab. Accompanied by a courteous driver, climb aboard your traditional Hackney black cab and set out to explore London’s most opulent attractions. Cruise past Buckingham Palace, official residence of her Majesty the Queen, and gaze at the stolid turrets of the Tower of London. Delve deep into the rich history of the British monarchy and visit lesser-known sites linked to the royal family while receiving undivided attention from your private guide.
events.name: Private Tour: Traditional Black Cab Tour of Royal London

events.description: Travelers that want an upscale experience exploring London shouldn't bother with a typical sightseeing tour, with a rigid itinerary and group of travelers. Opt for this inclusion-packed two-day adventure instead, where your personal guide whisks you through the city, offering views of top landmarks and attractions. Beyond the sightseeing, highlights include your private travel, four meals, and included five star accommodations. For travelers that want a luxury touch, this VIP tour truly leaves nothing to be desired.
events.name: London VIP Luxury Sightseeing with Professional Guide

events.description: Visit castles and national parks, and discover some of Wales’ top scenery, on this seamless, 3-day tour from Manchester. On the first morning, hop aboard your top-of-the-range, 16-seat Mercedes mini-coach and head across the border into Wales—explore Conwy Castle, Snowdonia National Park, and more. On the second day, visit Brecon Beacons National Park, charming coastal villages, and elegant castles; and on the third day, stop at Harlech Castle before crossing the border and exploring Chester and its cathedral. B&b (or hotel) accommodation, transit, and guided tours are included.
events.name: 3-Day Snowdonia, North Wales and Chester Small-Group Tour from Manchester

events.description: Unless you hire a car, exploring the Sussex South Downs National Park from London means catching trains, buses, and even cabs. After a train ride to Brighton, this full-day trip lays everything on with a deluxe minivan tour in a personalized, small-group atmosphere. Admire the rolling downs at Devil’s Dyke, see Beachy Head and the Seven Sisters cliffs, travel country roads, and more, all with a guide for deeper insight.
events.name: Full Day Small-Group White Cliffs of Sussex Tour from London

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/123799P12/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Windsor Castle Private Car Tour

events.description: Step into the world of the Grantham family with this Downton Abbey tour from London. You’ll visit all the landmarks linked to the hugely popular TV series including Highclere Castle and Bampton, which starred as Downton village. Lunch at a traditional British pub in the Cotswolds is included, along with insider gossip and fun facts about the TV drama and its stars.
events.name: Luxury Downton Abbey Experience with Lunch

events.description: Find yourself in the world of Downton Abbey during this 9-hour tour from central London. With your guide in the lead, sharing anecdotes and behind-the-scenes information, stop first in the village of Bampton, used as the Downton village setting. At Highclere Castle, spend three hours on a self-guided tour of the rooms used for most of the hit show's filming.
events.name: Downton Abbey and Village Tour from London by Coach

events.description: Have only a limited amount of time in London? See the city’s top sights in the space of a single bus tour—and enjoy a different perspective on the British capital when you explore after dark. Meet in central London as twilight descends, and climb aboard your open-top bus. You’ll discover landmarks ranging from Buckingham Palace and Tower Bridge to St. Paul’s Cathedral and the Tower of London. Learn the stories behind the sights from your guide’s live commentary; audio guides are additionally available in 11 languages.
events.name: London by Night Sightseeing Open Top Bus Tour with Live Commentary

events.description: Enjoy a delicious meal and be serenaded by live jazz on this relaxing Sunday lunch cruise on the Thames River in London. Step aboard a comfortable sightseeing cruise boat as you sail by top London sights such as Big Ben, the London Eye, Tower Bridge and many other iconic landmarks. As you cruise, sit down to a delicious 3-course lunch and kick back to sparkling jazz classics including easy listening, Dixieland and trad jazz numbers played by a band of acclaimed musicians.
events.name: Sunday Lunch Jazz Cruise on the River Thames

events.description: Step into a world of Jane Austen during a day trip from London to Hampshire, the 18th-century novelist’s home. With your own private guide, you’ll travel through the county’s rural villages, exploring Winchester and stopping at Jane Austen’s House Museum where classics such as Emma and Pride and Prejudice were written or revised. The bespoke private tour is led by a knowledgeable guide so you’ll get all the background info on Jane Austen as you explore.
events.name: Jane Austen's House Museum and Historic Winchester: Private Tour from London

events.description: See the iconic London landmarks linked to Jimi Hendrix, Queen, the Rolling Stones, and other rock legends on a private black cab music tour. Choose the tour start time and duration and wait for your music industry expert cabbie at your hotel. Then head to the Abbey Road crossing featured on The Beatles’ album cover and beyond. A custom itinerary can also be created based on your personal music tastes.
events.name: Rock Cab Tours presents The Music Legends Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/26601P59/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Arrival Transfer Cruise terminal to London Hotel or London Airport

events.description: Make the most of your time in London with a skip-the-line reservation at London's Hard Rock Cafe. Breeze past the queue, grab your seat amidst fun rock-n-roll memorabilia and savor a 2- or 3-course American-style meal.
events.name: Skip the Line: Hard Rock Cafe London Old Park Lane Including Meal

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/162378P24/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Cotswold & Shakespeare Country Tour in Executive Vehicle Private for 6-8 person

events.description: Escape the bustling streets of London for the day and visit some of West England’s prettiest places on a full-day tour of Bath, Avebury, and Lacock. Ideal for history buffs, this tour covers the Roman spa town of Bath, replete with Georgian architecture, and the village of Lacock. Plus, visit Avebury to see the largest prehistoric stone circle in the world. This small-group tour is limited to six travelers.
events.name: Bath, Avebury and Lacock Village Small-Group Day Tour from London

events.description: Maximize your time in London with a hop-on hop-off bus tour. Choose a 24-, 48-, or 72-hour ticket and make the most of unlimited travel across seven different routes for the ticket validity period. Get views of top London sights such as the Tower of London and Big Ben from the open-top bus, listen to audio commentary and enjoy the flexibility to hop on and off at any of the well-placed stops. All 24-, 48-, 72-hour bus tickets also include a complimentary river cruise and three walking tour routes.
events.name: London City Tour Hop On - Hop Off with Free Walking Tour and River Cruise

events.description: Glimpse into the lifestyle of the Royals with this pass to London’s Kensington Palace. Enjoy faster access to the venue and while away the hours exploring the opulent space, once home to Queen Victoria and Princess Diana. Tour the King’s and Queen’s State Apartments and the Palace Gardens, and learn the intimate history of Queen Victoria at the fascinating ‘Victoria Revealed’ exhibition – set within her own room adorned with personal objects.
events.name: Kensington Palace Entrance Ticket

events.description: Discover the magical world of Harry Potter with your family on a private 2.5-hour tour. Fun for adults and kids alike, the London excursion takes you to numerous filming locations used in the movies. Highlights include Diagon Alley (Leadenhall Market), the Ministry of Magic (Scotland Place), and of course, Platform 9¾ at King’s Cross Station. Along the way, enjoy Harry Potter themed games and trivia.
events.name: The Magic of Harry Potter Private Guided Tour for Kids and Families in London

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/148608P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Tour - Tower of London

events.description: Visit some of England's top sights on this full-day trip to Oxford, Stratford-upon-Avon, and Warwick Castle from London. Head to Stratford-upon-Avon for a private tour of Shakespeare’s Schoolroom before it opens to the public. Continue to Warwick Castle, Britain’s greatest medieval fortress. Soak up its colorful history brought alive by actors, Madame Tussauds' waxworks, and special effects, as you explore independently. Then travel to Oxford for a walking tour of highlights including its ivy-clad university colleges, libraries, and chapels.
events.name: Oxford, Warwick Castle, and Stratford-upon-Avon Day Trip from London

events.description: Boxing Day is the day after Christmas when Brits visit loved ones, tuck into leftover turkey, and hit the stores in search of Boxing Day sale bargains. Steer clear of the shoppers and swap London’s city sights for the beauty of rural England on this full-day trip. Step back into the Middle Ages at Warwick Castle, enjoy a guided tour of the honey-hued city of Oxford, and see the birthplace of William Shakespeare and stop for lunch in Stratford-upon-Avon.
events.name: Boxing Day Tour to Warwick Castle, Stratford-upon-Avon, The Cotswolds and Oxford

events.description: Make your London adventure a personal one on a private 8-hour sightseeing tour. Your tailor made itinerary can include Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, the city’s hidden gems, and much more. It's up to you. Thanks to the expert navigation skills of your Londoner guide, you’re able to explore in an efficient, but leisurely manner. Leave with exclusive tips on what to see, eat, and do with the rest of your vacation.
events.name: Must See London with a Local: Private & Personalized

events.description: Go on the trail of 'Doc Martin,' the star of the British medical TV comedy that’s filmed around Port Isaac on the north Cornwall coast. While loved for its dramatic scenery, the coastline can be tricky to navigate without a car, so this 2-day trip solves the problem. You’ll travel directly from your hotel in London, Windsor, Bath, Exeter, or Winchester, and visit 'Doc Martin' filming sites and other Cornwall highlights over two days with your own private guide. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.
events.name: Private Tour of Doc Martin and Port Wenn in Cornwall

events.description: Uncover the mysteries of England’s fascinating past on a full-day excursion to Stonehenge, Glastonbury, and Avebury from London. With a guide, learn about the legends surrounding King Arthur, the ancient stone circles of Salisbury, and the mystical island of Avalon. Take in views of the English countryside and see landmarks including the Chalice Well and the Glastonbury Tor. Receive personalized attention from your guide on this small-group tour, limited to only 16 people.
events.name: Small-Group Day Trip to Stonehenge, Glastonbury, and Avebury from London

events.description: With its colossal collection of more than 2,300 masterpieces, visiting London’s National Gallery can sometimes feel a little overwhelming. Ensure you see the best of the gallery’s magnificent works on this 2 to 2.5-hour guided tour, led by an art enthusiast. Admire iconic pieces by legends such as Van Gogh, Da Vinci, Botticelli, and Rembrandt, and appreciate minor details invisible to the untrained eye. This small-group tour is limited to eight people to maintain an intimate atmosphere.
events.name: The National Gallery of London Guided Museum Tour - Semi-Private 8ppl Max

events.description: Discover the beauty and history of Royal London by bike on a morning or afternoon city tour. Enjoy a 4-hour guided ride through Kensington Gardens, Hyde Park and St. James's Park. Cruise by the stately monuments such as the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben, and view Royal sites like Buckingham Palace, Kensington Palace and the Princess Diana Memorial. Along the way, learn about London’s rich history and contemporary culture.
events.name: London Royal Parks Bike Tour including Hyde Park

events.description: This is a great choice for travelers interested in exploring the highlights of London’s Westminster area in half a day. Save hours of research time and join a guide for a thorough discovery tour that covers some of London’s most notable buildings. See Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Downing Street, the Houses of Parliament, and more. No need to wait in long ticket lines as entry to Westminster Abbey is included.
events.name: Westminster Walking Tour & Westminster Abbey Entry

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/195781P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Brigit's Afternoon Tea Bus

events.description: Escape to the countryside on this full-day tour of Oxford, Stratford-upon-Avon and the Cotswolds from London. Follow in the footsteps of Shakespeare as you visit his birthplace in Stratford-Upon-Avon, stop for photos in the idyllic villages of the Cotswolds, then enjoy a walking tour of Oxford, home to the world’s oldest university.
events.name: Small Group Cotswolds Villages, Stratford and Oxford Day Tour from London

events.description: Immerse yourself in the tragedy of ‘The Phantom of The Opera’ at Her Majesty’s Theatre in London. The world’s highest-grossing musical, this multi-award-winning show features an Andrew Lloyd Webber score that turns its story of a mythical figure from shadowy Paris Opera House into a sensation. Be swept away by the love story to timeless melodies including the rousing ‘The Music of the Night.’ Choose standard-price or top-price seating for this London Phantom of The Opera production, and upgrade to enjoy a 2-course restaurant dinner before the show.
events.name: Phantom of the Opera Theater Show

events.description: England’s capital goes all out for the holidays, and this tour takes you to see the city’s Christmas light displays and markets to get you into the spirit of the season. Follow your guide through Leicester Square and Trafalgar Square as you snap pictures of the Christmas lights along the way.
