You’ll get a fascinating glimpse into Kahlo’s life and work in “Casa Azul,” then take in the main sites in Coyoacan. Next, head to Xochimilco for an hour-long boat ride in a trajinera, following a series of flower-lined canals. The tour concludes with a trip through the UNAM campus, including a series of beloved murals by Diego Rivera, O’Gorman, and Siqueiros.
events.name: Frida Kahlo, Xochimilco, and National University Tour

events.description: Escape the city and experience the gorgeous mountain city of Taxco and the colonial capital of Cuernavaca on an overnight excursion from Mexico City. Admire Cuernavaca’s mansions, avenues and perpetual spring weather before heading to the city that bills itself the “World Capital of Silver.” Wander Taxco’s cobblestone streets and buy silver work from a local craftsman. Hotel, lunch, guide and transportation are all included in this convenient outing.
events.name: Taxco Overnight

events.description: Explore Mexico City like a local and let a like-minded resident craft your itinerary. Share your interests and preferences—anything from live music and lucha libre to history and food—and let a local with an expert knowledge of Mexico’s vibrant capital city craft a personalized tour. Enjoy a unique experience and explore places that you’ll never see in a guide book.
events.name: The Floating Flower Gardens of Xochimilco

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/101749P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Teotihuacan with a private guide

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/33804P20/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Tour Museum of Anthropology and Chapultepec Castle.

events.description: This guided tour to Xochimilco and Casa Azul offers an incredible value for visitors. When you book, not only do you receive entrance fees to both attractions, but you also have transportation in the bag to the far-flung destinations. Plus, your guide is there to answer any questions throughout the day.
events.name: Coyoacan Frida Kahlo's house and Xochimilco all day tour

events.description: Find the vibrant street art hidden all over Mexico City on a guided bike tour that explores some of the city's most colorful neighborhoods. Cycling through the city with a local guide means you'll get insights into the thriving street art scene, from stencils to spray paint, stickers, and murals. Group size is limited to 10 people to ensure a more personalized experience as you go way off the tourist trail to learn about the roots and cutting edge of Mexico City art.
events.name: URBAN GALLERY Mexico City Street Art Bike Tour

events.description: Immerse yourself in Mexico City’s food and craft markets with an in-the-know guide, and then tour the UNESCO World Heritage site of Teotihuacán. Discover a ‘witch market,’ a flower-market extravaganza, and sample treats like tamales and tostadas, before exploring Teotihuacán’s ancient pyramids. Make your way to the apex of the Sun Pyramid for incredible views, and then cap your day off with a home-cooked meal at a family home. On this small-group experience limited to just 12 people, you’ll take in memorable sights and learn about local sustainable businesses.
events.name: Mexico City Tour of Mexico City Markets & Teotihuacan Pyramids

events.description: Experience some of Mexico City’s important landmarks on this all-day guided excursion. After a convenient hotel pickup, visit the pre-Columbian trading center of Tlateloco, ascend the Pyramids of the Sun and Moon at the legendary Teotihuacan, stop by the Basilica de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, the country’s largest shrine to the beloved Lady of Guadalupe. Finish with a tour of Paseo de Reforma and its iconic neighborhoods and monuments.
events.name: Guadalupe Shrine And Teotihuacan Pyramids Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/30791P610/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: CDMX taco experience

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/110186P14/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico City: Lucha Libre Wrestling Tour

events.description: Enrich your experience of Mexico City’s world-class Museum of Anthropology with a guided walking tour. Learn about the country’s ancient, pre-Columbian cultures from a bilingual and certified guide. See important artifacts like the Mexica Sun Stone, monumental Teotihuacan sculptures, and the tomb of Mayan King Pakal with museum admission included in the tour price.
events.name: Anthropology Museum Private Experience Walking Tour

events.description: Explore Mexico City’s vibrant food scene with an insider on this guided excursion. Start with a quick shopping trip to beloved Ciudadela market for handicrafts, then head to a market specializing in ancient indigenous food, and a drinking hole serving a traditional 1,000-year-old beverage. Finish with tastes of colonial-era cuisine mixing European and ancient flavors and traditional Mexico City dishes.
events.name: Flavors of Mexico - Mexican Food Experiencie

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/7626P568/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Market Tour and Traditional Mexican Cooking in a Beautiful Home

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/50417P13/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Casa Luis Barragan + Casa Gilardi

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5232P93/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: COMBO - Mexico city tour + Guadalupe Shrine & Teotihuacan Pyramids (2 days)

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5232P90/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: GUADALUPE SHRINE AND TEOTIHUACAN PYRAMIDS FROM MEXICO CITY

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/87068P16/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Coyoacán, Xochimilco, Frida Kahlo & Anahuacalli Museums

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/110216P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Tour Xochimilco,Coyoacan y Museo Frida Kahlo

events.description: Follow in the footsteps of in-the-know journalists on a walking tour of Mexico City, inspired by the New York Times’ travel guide. Discover often-overlooked cultural gems, including Mercado Roma and the Franz Mayer Museum, and sample a range of city specialties while gaining insight into Mexico City’s history, fashion, and cuisine from your local guide.
events.name: Mexico City: 'New York Times Journeys' Afternoon Food, Markets, Art Walking Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/160124P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Teotihuacan + Basilica de Guadalupe + Tlatelolco Tour!

events.description: A sprawling metropolis brimming with history, energy, and plenty to do, Mexico City is a treat for visitors to explore. This guided tour helps first-time visitors get oriented and check out essential attractions. Along with a guide, head to key sights such as the Palace of Fine Arts, Zocalo, and the National Palace—all entrance fees are included so you can go right in. This tour also includes a sample of traditional sweets for an added taste of local culture.
events.name: Walking Tour Historical City Center & Typical Sweet Tasting - Small Group

events.description: Enjoy traditional folk dancing from all around the country at the Folkloric Ballet in Mexico City. Set at the UNESCO listed Palacio de Bellas Artes, the 2-hour performance keeps you entertained from beginning to end. There’s no need to wait at the will call desk, as the tickets are delivered to your hotel or apartment before the show.
events.name: Folkloric Ballet Admission Ticket in Mexico City

events.description: Make the most of limited time with this flexible introductory tour of Mexico City. After convenient airport pickup, personalize your itinerary suit your interests. Travel with a private guide and your group of up to four people to eat at gourmet restaurants, linger at the world-class Museum of Anthropology, stroll past Aztec ruins in the historic center’s Aztec ruins, or marvel at the murals of Mexican masters.
events.name: Layover City Tour

events.description: Hike Mexico’s fourth tallest peak, the 13,000-foot (4,000-meter) Nevado de Toluca, with the help of a mountain guide. Explore this extinct volcano, its twin lakes, and spectacular scenery during a full-day adventure. Trekkers must be healthy, in appropriate shape, and equipped with hiking boots for this nearly 5-mile (8-kilometer) hike. For your security, trekking poles and accident insurance are included in the tour cost.
events.name: Hike at Nevado de Toluca Volcano

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/137460P23/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico: Private tour to Xochimilco, Coyoacan & Frida Kahlo Museum

events.description: Experience Mexico City’s vibrant food culture on a private tour that explores classic tacos, mezcal, and Mexican craft beer. With a local guide to lead the way, you’ll discover colorful neighborhoods in the capital city, making a series of tasting stops for an evening of food and fun. This private food tour includes all food and drink tastings, as well as pickup and drop-off at hotels in Mexico City.
events.name: Taco Night Private Food Tour in Mexico City

events.description: Visit the historic towns of Cholula and Puebla on a full-day excursion from Mexico City that explores pre-Columbian monuments, colonial-era architecture, and local artwork. In Cholula, you’ll see a towering pyramid with ancient murals, then discover the colorful tiles that decorate Puebla’s historic center, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. With pickup and drop-off at select hotels in Mexico City, and all transport by climate-controlled minivan, this small-group tour is a convenient way to see two fascinating cities in a single day.
events.name: Puebla And Cholula Tour From Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/137460P18/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico: Private walking tour in Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/87068P17/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Dolores Olmedo, Frida Kahlo & Anahuacalli Museums

events.description: Gain special insight into Teotihuacán on this walking tour led by an art historian–guide with particular expertise in the UNESCO World Heritage site. See the pre-Columbian Mesoamerican ‘City of the Gods’ early in the morning, and watch as the sun rises over the pyramids. Enjoy the serene, mystical atmosphere as you visit the Citadel, the Avenue of the Dead, Sun and Moon pyramids, Quetzalpapalotl Palace and more. Learn about their archaeological significance, stories about this ancient city and the latest discoveries.
events.name: Teotihuacan Archaeology Tour

events.description: Discover one of the world’s most impressive collections of artifacts from pre-Columbian Maya civilizations through Spanish colonization at the National Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City. An informative guide provides historical and archaeological context to the exhibits, including the Aztec Calendar, reconstructions of Maya tombs and giant Olmec heads. After this half-day tour, you’ll come away with insight into the influence of Mesoamerican cultures on Mexico today.
events.name: National Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City: Admission and Guide

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/17972P548/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Departure Transfer from Mexico City Center to Mexico Airport

events.description: Start your trip to Mexico City with a private transfer from Mexico City International Airport (aka Benito Juarez International Airport) to your centrally located city hotel. Travel in the comfort of a private vehicle, and skip the taxi lines and shared shuttles. This transport service is available during 24 hours, seven days a week.
events.name: Private Arrival Transfer: Mexico City Airport to Hotel

events.description: Explore Mexico City’s celebrated murals on this affordable walking tour through the historic center. With an informative guide leading the way, marvel at incredible works by Diego Rivera, José Clemente Orozco, David Alfaro Siqueiros and other Mexican masters. Enrich your experience by gaining insights into the lives of these influential artists and learning about the impact of their work.
events.name: Mexican muralism

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/8653P421/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Arrival Transfer from Mexico City airport to Central Hotels

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/50417P11/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Luis Barragan architecture tour 1 day in Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/8653P424/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Departure Transfer from Mexico City hotels to Mexico City airport

events.description: Discover the UNESCO-listed historic center of Mexico City during a half-day guided tour that includes a visit to the National Museum of Anthropology. Learn from your guide about significant landmarks such as the National Palace, Zócalo, Metropolitan Cathedral, and more. You'll get to know the city and Mexican culture.
events.name: Mexico City Half-Day Tour with Museum of Anthropology

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5885P352/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Puebla and Cholula Full-Day Tour from Puebla

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/136132P6/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Discover the Folkloric Ballet of Mexico

events.description: Get an intimate view of two popular Mexico City sites on an intimate guided tour. Experience the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe and learn why this national shrine lures millions of pilgrims annually. Then head to the ancient Mexican ruins of Teotihuacan, delve into its mysteries and climb the Pyramids of the Sun and Moon. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.
events.name: Basilica of Guadalupe and Teotihuacan Archaeological Site

events.description: Get to know the Pueblos Magicos, or 'Magic Towns,' in Hidalgo on this day trip from Mexico City. With your guide in the lead, learn about daily life in these colonial towns, as well as their cultural and historical significance to the region. Round-trip transportation from a central meeting point in Mexico City included.
events.name: Pueblos Magicos Cultural Day Trip: Real del Monte and Huasca de Ocampo

events.description: The former capital of the Aztec Empire, the “City of Gods”—Teotihuacan—is Mexico’s most famous pre-Colombian attraction. But long entrance lines mean losing precious sightseeing time. With these skip-the-line admission tickets, you’ll make the most of your visit to the awe-inspiring archaeological site—without the wait. Explore stepped pyramids and vibrant murals from the 1,000-year-old ruins at your own pace, with more time to take in the sights.
events.name: Skip The Line: Teotihuacan Entrance Ticket

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/108297P4/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: ENJOY TEOTIHUACAN WITH A LOCAL

events.description: Experience some of Mexico City’s important landmarks on this all-day guided excursion. After a convenient hotel pickup, climb the Pyramids of the Sun and Moon at the legendary Teotihuacan, stop by Basilica de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, the country’s largest shrine to the beloved Lady of Guadalupe, and explore the pre-Columbian trading center of Tlateloco.
events.name: Teotihuacan, Shrine of Guadalupe & Tlatelolco Day Tour

events.description: Experience Mexico City’s highlights on one affordable half-day tour. After a convenient hotel pickup, travel to the capital’s UNESCO-designated historic center. With an informative guide leading the way, visit famous murals, the central plaza, ancient Aztec Templo Mayor, the Metropolitan Cathedral and other top attractions. Cap off your outing at Chapultapec Park—home to world-class museums and the former presidential palace—and the vibrant commercial district of Zona Rosa.
events.name: MEXICO CITY TOUR

events.description: With fascinating history and culture, Mexico City is an exciting place to visit, but exploring one of the largest cities in the world can be overwhelming even for experienced travelers. Find the best of Mexico City using public transit with a local guide, on a full-day, small group tour that covers Aztec heritage, Mexican art, architecture, and food.
events.name: Mexico City Small Group Tour with a Local Guide

events.description: Experience some of Mexico City’s important landmarks on this all-day guided excursion. After a convenient hotel pickup, visit the pre-Columbian trading center of Tlateloco, stop by the Basilica de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, the country’s largest shrine to the beloved Lady of Guadalupe, and ascend the Pyramids of the Sun and Moon at the legendary Teotihuacan. Enjoy a delicious local lunch and a tasting of Pulque, a lightly alcoholic Aztec drink.
events.name: Full-Day Teotihuacan & Basilica Guadalupe Tour

events.description: Explore Mexico City with a local guide who shares the history and landmarks of the Mexican capital. See the highlights of the city including the National Palace, the grand Metropolitan Cathedral, and Chapultepec Park. Hear about the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Historic Center of Mexico City and learn more about the Aztecs and Mesoamerica at the National Museum of Anthropology. Your tour includes entrance fees, transportation in an air-conditioned minivan, and hotel pickup and drop-off.
events.name: Mexico City Tour with Anthropology Museum

events.description: This Six Flags Mexico City ticket gives you 6-hour access to the amusement park’s attractions, rides and shows, like Batman, Superman and the Dark Knight Coaster. Have a blast exploring the park’s seven themed sections, including Adventure Kingdom.  Hotel transport is included.
events.name: Six Flags Mexico City General Admission Ticket

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5885P350/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Taxco and Cuernavaca Day Trip from Taxco

events.description: Visit Lake Chapala for gorgeous landscapes, food, and sights on a full-day tour from Guadalajara. See the ranch home of popular Mexican singer Vicente Fernandez, stroll on the shore of Lake Chapala—the largest lake in Mexico, then visit the picturesque town of Ajijic before stopping to purchase lunch at a typical restaurant on the lake. Includes guide, transportation by air-conditioned minivan, and pickup and drop-off at select hotels.
events.name: Full-Day Lake Chapala Tour from Guadalajara

events.description: See a different side of Mexico City with this small-group walking tour of Roma Norte. Roma is beloved by locals for its impressive architecture, creative atmosphere, and vibrant food culture. Walk the tree-lined streets and stop for eight delicious tastings at specialty shops, farm-to-table restaurants, and more. As you pause to admire plazas and other landmarks, your guide will share historical information on this truly distinctive area.
events.name: Mexico City: Top Chef Culinary Adventure

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/167611P6/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Tour to Xochimilco

events.description: See Mexico City through its murals on this walking tour to four of the most impressive walls in the historical center of Mexico City. Follow your guide to mural locations including the National Palace and Palacio de Bellas Artes, and learn how the murals reflect Mexico’s history and culture at each.
events.name: Walking Tour - Impressive murals in Historical Center of Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/87068P15/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Xochimilco & Frida Kahlo Museum

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/88859P9/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Tour to Teotihuacan Pyramids in the morning. Be the first to arrive!

events.description: Combine two quintessential Mexico City day trips in a single package to save. Pick two consecutive days to visit Cholula and Puebla, then Taxco and Cuernavaca on the next day. Round-trip transportation from a central Mexico City meeting point included.
events.name: Mexico City Super Saver: Puebla and Cholula Plus Taxco and Cuernavaca Day Trips

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/136515P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Gourmet Walking Food Tour Mexico City - Rico Tours - Centro Historico

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/160124P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Xochimilco + Coyoacan + Estadio Azteca + UNAM

events.description: Explore the Cacahuamilpa Caves and the town of Taxco on this guided all-day tour from Mexico City. In Cacahuamilpa, enter the cave system, which are considered the second largest in the world, and wander around the underground rooms. Afterward, travel to Taxco de Alarcon, where you’ll enjoy lunch and tour the town, including a visit to silversmiths, the Temple of Santa Prisca, and the Silver Museum.
events.name: TAXCO AND CACAHUAMILPA GROTTOS with lunch

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5885P355/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Teotihuacan on your Own

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5885P357/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Oaxaca in One Day From Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5885P361/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Frida Kahlo Museum Afternoon Tour

events.description: Each year, monarch butterflies migrate up to 3,000 miles from Canada to Mexico. See the phenomenon with your own eyes on a day trip to a butterfly sanctuary just outside Mexico City, where a guide ensures you learn more than you would if visiting on your own. Stops along the way include the Bridal Veil waterfall and colonial church of San Francisco.
events.name: Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary Day Trip from Mexico City

events.description: Knowing the best taco spots can be tricky for first-time visitors to Mexico City. Zip between taquerias with ease on a bike tour and enjoy plenty of authentic samples, as well as a refreshing Mezcal or beer, included in the price. Gain an overview of the city as you cycle and benefit from the intimate experience of a small-group tour.
events.name: ⭐El Taco Club | BIKE to taste the world's BEST TACOS!⭐

events.description: If you’ve already seen Mexico City’s top tourist attractions then discover a different side of the city on this mural art walking tour. In a small group limited to 14, you’ll visit some of Mexico City’s most famous murals and find out the inspiration and history behind them. Admire historic murals inspired by the Mexican revolution and visit the government-sponsored mural project at San Ildefonso College.
events.name: Mexico City Mural Art Small-Group Walking Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/167611P5/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Tour to pyramids in Teotihuacan

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/137460P25/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico: Private tour to Taxco & Xochicalco

events.description: Enjoy a hassle-free end to your Mexico City vacation with a private transfer from your hotel to Mexico City International Airport (aka Benito Juarez International Airport). Travel in the space and comfort of a private vehicle, and skip the shared shuttles. This transport service is available during 24 hours, seven days a week.
events.name: Private Departure Transfer: Hotel to Mexico City Airport

events.description: This guided 5-hour tour of Mexico City takes you into the Barrio Magico district of Coyoacán and the flowered waterways of Xochimilco, a UNESCO site. Pass by Coyoacán’s gorgeous 16th-century mansions, cobblestone streets and San Juan Bautista church. If you’re a fan of Frida Kahlo, you’ll enjoy La Casa Azul (the Blue House), her former home turned into a museum. Then, relax aboard a ‘trajinera’ boat for a tranquil float along Xochimilco’s canals that date back to Aztec times.
events.name: Coyoacán and Xochimilco including Frida Kahlo Museum

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/41370P14/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Historic Downtown Walking Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/76036P78/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico City Welcome Tour: Private Tour with a Local

events.description: Nuanced and complex, Mexican sauces define the cuisine and add a punch to any dish. This tour teaches you to distinguish amongst favorite: cook and taste 10 different sauces paired with street food tacos and appetizers and learn the secret ingredients behind each. Then, see the fresh ingredients that make each sauce so good on a walking tour of a local market.
events.name: Mastering Mexican Salsas Cooking Class and Market Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/70478P23/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico City Private Airport Transfer: Benito Juarez International (MEX)

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/125283P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mezcal Tasting & Speakeasy Crawl

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/127902P6/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Transfer From Mexico City Airport to Downtown

events.description: Experience some of Mexico City’s important landmarks on this all-day guided excursion. After a convenient hotel pickup, ascend the Pyramids of the Sun and Moon at the legendary Teotihuacan and stop by the Basilica de Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, the country’s largest shrine to the beloved Lady of Guadalupe. Learn about Mexico’s fascinating history from an experienced local guide along the way.
events.name: TEOTIHUACAN & GUADALUPE SHRINE (Private)

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5232P91/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: VISIT TO THE GUADALUPE SANCTUARY FROM MEXICO CITY

events.description: This private full-day tour features two Mexico City landmarks that are hard to reach by public transit: the Xochimilco canals and the Frida Kahlo Museum. In addition to navigating, your guide offers background information about neighborhoods passed during the itinerary, including Condesa and Coyoacan. A mariachi boat ride, skip-the-line museum admission, and round-trip hotel transport are included.
events.name: FRIDA KALHO IN XOCHIMILCO TROUGHT UNIVERSITY COYOACAN AND CUICUILCO PYRAMID

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/138165P289/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Arrival from Mexico Airport (MEX) to Mexico City Center

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/177613P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: TOUR TEOTIHUACAN

events.description: See Mexico City’s major attractions with this hop-on hop-off bus tour. Travel by an open-top, double-decker bus on this comprehensive sightseeing experience that covers the Zócalo, Revolution Monument, world-class museums, buildings and more highlights. Buses run regularly from morning until night, giving you the flexibility to explore the sprawling metropolis at a pace that suits you.
events.name: Mexico City Hop-On Hop-Off Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/139830P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Chapultepec E-Scooter Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/182746P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico City's Historical Center Icons

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/182746P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe Visit

events.description: Art and culture lovers can experience the sights, colors, and tastes of Mexico City’s Centro Historico on this private full-day walking tour. Home to more than 700 years of rich history, the UNESCO World Heritage Site lends itself well to walking: tick off top attractions such as the Murales de Diego Riviera and visit Templo Mayor and the National Palace of Fine Arts.
events.name: History, Colors & Tequila: Real Downtown Experience

events.description: It can be tricky for time-limited travelers to tick off Mexico City’s outlying attractions. Optimize your time on a day tour to Teotihuacan and the Basilica de Guadalupe, taking advantage of round-trip transfer to travel quickly and easily between dispersed locations. Learn more about Mexico’s ancient and colonial history from your guide, and keep energized during a full day of sightseeing with lunch included in the price.
events.name: Basilica de Guadalupe and Teotihuacan Pyramids

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/138165P290/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Private Departure transfer from Mexico City Center to Mexico City Airport (MEX)

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/136515P3/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Tortilla Workshop in Famous San Juan Mercado, Mexico City

events.description: Master the art of preparing authentic Mexican salsa during an immersive cooking class. Lead by resident cooks, the class is a great opportunity to experience the local culinary culture with Mexico City natives. Begin with a visit to the bustling Tacuba Market to collect fresh ingredients for your sauces. With the help of your epicurean host, learn how to prepare raw, fried, boiled, and roasted salsas.
events.name: Learn to Cook Mexican Salsas

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/139168P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Murals Walking Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/125512P12/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico City Street Art Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/125512P13/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: La Roma Art Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/192980P1/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Let's enjoy Teotihuacan!!

events.description: Discover the beauty and culture of Mexico City’s Roma and Condesa neighborhoods on a 3-hour bike tour. Hop on your provided set of wheels and follow your guide along the city’s many bike paths. The holistic tour takes a look at both the historical and contemporary sides of the vibrant 'colonias'. Part way through, enjoy lunch on the street as the locals do with traditional options to suit every diet.
events.name: ART NACÓ Roma-Condesa Bike tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/123785P5/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Hiking from Culture to Nature

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/66397P2/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Skip the Line: Inbursa Aquarium Admission Ticket in Mexico City

events.description: Delve deeper into the life and times of the Russian government dissenter Leon Trotsky at the Leon Trotsky Museum in Mexico City, where Trotsky fled after the issue of his death warrant in Russia. Booking your admission ticket in advance means that you’ll avoid long lines at the entrance booth and enjoy the flexibility of visiting the museum at a time that suits your schedule.
events.name: Admission Ticket: Museo Casa de Leon Trotsky

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5232P83/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Shared Transfer Mexico city Airport - Mexico city Downtown hotels

events.description: Skip public transit and let a guide navigate for you to the ancient archaeological site of Teotihuacan. Going with a guide is essential, as it ensures you understand uses and meanings of the often unmarked ruins. After taking in panoramic views from the top of a pyramid, climb down and watch the sun set over the pre-Columbian city.
events.name: Small Group: Afternoon Guided tour to Teotihuacan from Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/136132P3/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Discover Taxco & Cuernavaca (Day Tour)

events.description: Take a few hours to learn the ins and outs of traditional Mexican cuisine—an experience often missed by visitors to Mexico City. The tour begins at a local market, where your guide navigates the crowds and shouting vendors for you. After learning about seasonal ingredients, follow your guide back to their home for an intimate cooking lesson and round out the day with a freshly-prepared meal.
events.name: Private Market Tour and Hands-On Home Cooking With a Local in Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5232P92/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: SIX FLAGS PROMOTION 2019

events.description: Make the most of limited time in Mexico City with this jam-packed tour. See many of the capital’s cultural and historical highlights on one convenient, affordable excursion. Save time with hotel pickup and drop off and transportation between far-flung attractions in a climate-controlled minivan. Experience the city’s main square, the Metropolitan Cathedral, the Aztec Templo Mayor, the floating gardens and canals of Xochimilco and more with a small group.
events.name: City Tour and Xochimilco

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/101749P4/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Explore Anthropology Museum in Mexico City

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/87205P21/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Round-Trip Transfer in Private Vehicle from-to México Airport in México City

events.description: When you land at Mexico City International Airport, bypass the long taxi lines and travel to your hotel in a comfortable vehicle waiting for you. This round-trip shared transfer also includes the trip back to the airport at the end of your stay. It’s a relaxing way to begin and end your vacation in Mexico City. Hotel zones for this transfer include Mexico City, Reforma, Santa Fe, North Zone and the South Zone.
events.name: Mexico City Airport Round Trip Transfer

events.description: Visit Teotihuacan without the crowds and see the sights of Mexico City’s historic center on this tour that provides an easy way to check off the city’s major attractions in just one day. Start by heading to Teotihuacan in the early morning, just as it opens, beating most of the visitors from the city. Explore the ancient plazas and pyramids of this UNESCO World Heritage Site, then return to Mexico City for a guided tour of the Zocalo, home to landmarks like the National Palace and Metropolitan Cathedral.
events.name: Mexico City in One Day: Teotihuacan Pyramids Early Access and Historical City Sightseeing Tour

events.description: Get the most out of your time in Mexico City with a private half-day tour of the city’s main attractions. Your personal driver will chauffeur you through Mexico’s capital in a secure and comfortable vehicle, which your group of up to four passengers will have entirely to yourselves. Enjoy the Angel of Independence, Zócalo and more knowing you and your family are on a safe outing.
events.name: Mexico City Private Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5885MEXAPTHTL/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico City Shared Arrival Transfer

events.description: Combine some of Mexico City's most popular landmarks in a single private tour. Over the course of 10 hours with a dedicated guide, you and your private party will ride a trajinera through Xochimilco, explore Coyoacan, visit the National Autonomous University of Mexico, and enjoy admission to the Frida Kahlo Museum. Pickup and drop-off at Mexico City hotels.
events.name: Private Tour: Xochimilco, Coyoacán and Frida Kahlo Museum

events.description: Experience Xochimilco, a marine ecological reserve and UNESCO World Heritage site, located just south of Mexico City. Step aboard a ‘trajinera,’ a colorful flat-bottomed boat, and drift through waterways dotted with floating gardens of flowers. Learn from an informative guide how this former agricultural canal network once fed the Aztec capital that lined the shores of Lake Xochimilco. Then, stroll through the National University of Mexico on a brief tour, where you’ll see an outdoor art gallery and a bullfighting ring. Hotel transport included.
events.name: Xochimilco and National University of Mexico

events.description: Experience Mexico City’s culinary delights on this guided street food excursion with a local host. Enjoy a custom-crafted tour and get off the beaten path to taste the best tacos and tortas, pozole and mole, sopes and ezquites. Learn about the city’s famous food scene and enjoy eight to 10 dishes, beer, and other alcoholic beverages—they’re included in the tour price.
events.name: Eat like a local in Mexico City: private & personalized

events.description: Discover some of Mexico’s best preserved ruins on a full-day private tour from Mexico City. The tour removes all stress and guesswork with private transportation, included admission to both sites, and lunch at a local restaurant. Enjoy thorough tours of Tula and Teotihuacan, with ample opportunity to ask questions. Then, have free time to explore or climb the Pyramid of the Sun.
events.name: Private Tour: Pyramids of Teotihuacan and Piramides of Atlantes de Tula

events.description: Experience Mexico City at night in all its rambunctious glory on this 3-hour guided tour. Admire the illuminated monuments of the Zocalo, one of the largest city plazas in the world, before you revel in the festivities of Plaza Garibaldi. Listen to mariachi bands, dance to live music, watch a folkloric show and witness a symbolic cockfight in the square. Enjoy a complimentary drink and the convenience of hotel transport.
events.name: Garibaldi Night Tour

events.description: Discover the roots of Mexico City’s thriving art and cultural scene on a 9 to 10-hour private tour of the National Museum of Anthropology, Frida Kahlo Museum, and Leon Trotsky Museum, all led by a private guide with a history degree. Personalize your educational experience of the museums and the bohemian Coyoacan district, and travel through the city's traffic in comfort with private transportation.
events.name: Private Full-Day Museums of Mexico City Tour

events.description: With more than 20 million annual visitors, the Shrine of Guadalupe in Mexico City is one of the top Catholic pilgrimage sites in the world. On this tour, an informative guide takes you to the shrine’s two basilicas to see a cloak with an image of the Lady Virgin on display. Climb nearby Tepeyac Hill, where it is said the Lady appeared, and hear more about the events that led to the construction of the shrine. Transport from central Mexico City is included.
events.name: Shrine of Guadalupe Tour in Mexico City

events.description: Wondering what’s worth seeing in Mexico? This 8-day tour starting in Mexico City has your itinerary all mapped out for you. Travel with a guide to see the Shrine of Guadalupe, UNESCO-listed Teotihuacan pyramids, Mayan towns of Palenque and Campeche, Uxmal, Chichén Itzá, and more. Experience the comforts of 4- or 5-star hotel accommodations along the way, and end your Mexico tour on the stunning Caribbean beaches of Cancun or the Mayan Riviera.
events.name: 8-Day Best of Mexico Tour: Mexico City to Cancun

events.description: Visit the home and neighborhood of beloved Mexican artist Frida Kahlo on this half-day excursion. Explore “The Blue House”—as the house where Kahlo was born and died is known—and learn about her difficult but fascinating life. See her paintings and precious personal objects before touring Coyoacan, the beautiful neighborhood where she was born. Stop by a 16th century church and a local market and for a delicious complimentary tostada.
events.name: Frida Kahlo Museum, Coyoacán & Market - Small Group - English Only

events.description: Get personalized attention and a flexible itinerary on this private tour of Mexico City. Visit the local markets to peruse for souvenirs, see Garibaldi Square, and do tastings at the Tequila and Mezcal Museum. Experience a ride in trajinera, or a small commuter boat, in Xochimilco. This private tour for just you and your party includes all entrance fees and round-trip private transportation from your hotel.
events.name: Mexico City Private Tour: Ethnic Markets, Tequila and Mezcal Museum, Xochimilco

events.description: Gaze at the twinkling lights of Mexico City during a 3-course dinner at Bellini, the world's largest revolving restaurant. Located on the 45th floor of the city’s World Trade Center, Bellini offers 360-degree panoramas as you feast on Mexican and international cuisine. Whether you’re on a romantic date or with your family, this will be a dining experience to remember. Hotel transport included.
events.name: Dinner at the Revolving Bellini Restaurant in Mexico City

events.description: Combine Mexico City landmarks with ancient culture on a full-day tour that explores the historic center and Teotihuacan. You’ll see the sprawling main square and a series of murals by Diego Rivera, then continue to the temples and monuments of Teotihaucan, towering structures that awed the first European visitors. Climb the pyramids for sweeping views of the surrounding plains, and sip a glass of traditional pulque, with a local guide to share the fascinating stories behind each site.
events.name: Mexico City and Teotihuacan Archaeological Site

events.description: Experience picturesque San Miguel de Allende on an all-day trip from Mexico City. See the colonial city’s well-preserved 17th- and 18th-century structures, cobble stone streets, and lush Spanish-style courtyard on a private tour with a bilingual guide. This hassle-free outing takes you to and from the artsy, UNESCO-listed San Miguel in a convenient private vehicle with hotel pickup and drop off included.
events.name: Private Tour: San Miguel de Allende Day Trip from Mexico City

events.description: Mexico City’s busy streets can often make exploring by bike a difficult task. Follow a guide along the Mexican capital’s longest dedicated bike lane on a tour that reveals the history and beauty of Paseo de la Reforma and Chapultepec Park. A small group ensures safety and personalized attention, and a choice of morning or afternoon departure allows you to slot this tour into even the busiest of sightseeing schedules. This tour is also inclusive of a delicious street food lunch.
events.name: DEL EMPERADOR Chapultepec & Paseo de la Reforma Historical bike tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/5885MEXHTLAPT/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: Mexico City Airport Departure Transfer

events.description: Treat yourself to an unforgettable experience on the historic canals of Xochimilco. Save time, money, and hassle with this prepaid ticket for a 1-hour ride on a colorful trajinera. Just board your boat and then sit back and enjoy live music, food, drinks, and good company on the scenic waters of Xochimilco.
events.name: Skip the Line: Trajinera Ride Across Xochimilco's Canals

events.description: Buy your ticket to Mexico City’s National Museum of Anthropology in advance and enjoy skip-the-line admission. Avoid standing in a line that can be up to 1-hour long at this popular institution. Save time and go directly inside to see the museum’s internationally recognized permanent collection of pre-Columbian artifacts as well as its visiting exhibitions, which typically focus on cultures around the world.
events.name: Skip the Line: National Museum of Anthropology Entrance Ticket

events.description: Visit two gorgeous historic cities on a full-day trip from Mexico City to Cuernavaca and Taxco, traveling with a guide and small group that’s limited to 15 people. You’ll see the frescoes that adorn the Cuernavaca Cathedral, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that dates to the early 16th century. In Taxco, tour the Church of Santa Prisca, then browse locally-made silver jewelry in downtown shops. With pickup and drop-off in selected areas of Mexico City, this tour is a convenient way to discover Mexico's history beyond the capital.
events.name: Cuernavaca and Taxco Day Tour

events.description: Get an intimate view of Mexico’s capital city on this private walking tour. Learn Mexico City’s long and fascinating history from a local guide while checking out must-see sites like the ancient Aztec temple of Templo Mayor, the Palace of Fine Arts with its spectacular murals, and the National Palace, which is home of Mexico’s presidential offices. Get tips on the best taquerias and mezcalerias (mescal bars) in the city.
events.name: Private Mexico City Downtown Walking Tour

events.description: Tick off 3 of Mexico City’s top attractions on a day tour to Teotihuacan, the Square of the Three Cultures, and the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe, optimizing your sightseeing time with round-trip transfer from your hotel. Explore with a guide for deeper insight into Mexico’s history and culture, and avoid hidden costs with lunch and entrance fees included in the price.
events.name: Teotihuacan & Basilica Guadalupe Tour with lunch

events.description: Glide through Mexico City and experience its years of history in just a few hours by Segway. In a short period of time, zoom around effortlessly and see Chapultepec Park and surrounding areas. See Plaza Moliere, San Agustin Church and more, while learning unique and fascinating history from an informative guide. Wrap up your tour with a snack and beverage at a café in the upscale neighborhood of Polanco. This Mexico City Segway tour is limited to just six people, ensuring more personalized attention.
events.name: Mexico City Segway Tour: Chapultepec Park

events.description: Step into the world of ancient pre-Aztec and Toltec peoples on a private, full-day tour from Mexico City to Teotihuacan and Tula. You’ll walk the ‘Avenue of the Dead’ in Teotihuacan, then climb the Pyramid of the Sun for panoramic views of the sprawling ruins. Next, find platoons of carved Toltec warriors at Tula, along with a ruined palace and ball court. Traveling by climate-controlled vehicle, this full-day tour offers the convenience and personal service of a private guide, with entrance fees and hotel transfers included.
events.name: Teotihuacan and Tula Private Archeology Tour from Mexico City

events.description: No trip to Mexico City is complete with visiting Choula and Puebla, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Explore the traditional towns your way on a private custom tour that provides a personalized experience ideal for first-time visitors. With your guide driving, you’ll have more time to focus on the volcanic landscapes and will avoid getting lost on Mexico’s notoriously hard-to-navigate roads. Plus, convenient hotel pickup is included.
events.name: Private Tour Puebla and Cholula

events.description: Let a guide navigate for you to 2 cornerstones of Mexican culture on a day trip from Mexico City. After your first stop at the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe, the national shrine of Mexico, explore the ancient archaeological site of Teotihuacan. Going with a guide is essential, as many of the ruins are unmarked and needs context. Hotel transport is included for your convenience.
events.name: Teotihuacan and Guadalupe Shrine

events.description: Experience the majestic World Heritage-listed Blue Mountains on a small-group full-day tour from Sydney. Enjoy sweeping views of the Blue Mountains and sites including the Three Sisters and Jamison Valley. Hop on board the Scenic Railway (or other rides) at Scenic World, enjoy a chef-prepared lunch (dietary requirements accommodated), and visit Featherdale Wildlife Park to see kangaroos and other native Australian critters. Then, cruise by boat back to Sydney Harbour on the Parramatta River.
events.name: All Inclusive Blue Mountains Small-Group Day Trip from Sydney

events.description: Climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge for unrivaled views from a height of 440 feet (134 meters) on this Australian landmark. Choose a half-day BridgeClimb with a guide in the morning or afternoon, or climb at dawn, twilight or night. Choose from several other options, including a Sampler Climb that takes you halfway up, or a BridgeClimb Express for a rigorous ascent at a faster pace. Climbs to the summit are limited to 14 participants to ensure personalized attention in a small group.
events.name: Sydney BridgeClimb

events.description: If snorkeling on the Great Barrier Reef is on your bucket list, don’t miss this day trip from Cairns. You’ll visit two different locations on the barrier reef for the chance to see tropical marine life in the clear waters. Lunch is included on board the boat, and you have the option to upgrade to include additional adventures such as introductory or certified scuba diving or a helicopter flight over this UNESCO World Heritage site. Both water sports enthusiasts and novices are welcome.
events.name: Great Barrier Reef Diving and Snorkeling Cruise from Cairns

events.description: See the best of Sydney when you book this combination of best-selling tours at a great savings. that includes a full day of sightseeing in Sydney followed by a day trip to the Blue Mountains. In Sydney, get to know the city and Bondi Beach on a coach tour, then take a Sydney Harbour lunch cruise to get out on the water. Visit the World Heritage-listed Blue Mountains, including Scenic World, Featherdale Wildlife Park, Echo Point, Three Sisters, Katoomba and Leura, then return via a Parramatta River cruise.
events.name: 2-Day Combo: Sydney City Tour, Sydney Harbour Lunch Cruise and Blue Mountains Day Trip

events.description: Hit all the highlights of Australia's Blue Mountains on this day tour from Sydney. View native Australian animals at Featherdale Wildlife Park, see the famous Three Sisters at Echo Park, then head for Scenic World (all three rides included). Wind up with a river cruise on the Parramatta back to Sydney for drop-off at Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. National Park fees and round-trip transportation from select hotels included.
events.name: All Inclusive Full-Day Blue Mountains Trip from Sydney

events.description: Explore the Blue Mountains on a full-day tour that features the UNESCO World Heritage-listed region’s natural beauty, including landmarks like Three Sisters, Jamison Valley, Leura and Scenic World. On the return trip to Sydney, meet native Australian wildlife at a Wildlife Park, then cruise into the city on a scenic Parramatta River cruise. Bonus: includes a delicious two-course lunch in Leura.
events.name: All-Inclusive Blue Mountains Day Trip with River Cruise

events.description: Take in breathtaking sights of long sandy beaches and dramatic cliffs on this guided, full-day tour of Australia’s Great Ocean Road. See some of the most spectacular coastal scenery on Earth, including the Twelve Apostles limestone stacks and the Gibson's Steps, site of a historic clifflines. Bushwalk in Great Otway National Park, and try out your koala-spotting skills at Kennett River. Travel in a deluxe minicoach with a small group for a relaxing, personalized experience.
events.name: Great Ocean Road Small-Group Ecotour from Melbourne

events.description: Spend six hours on the Great Barrier Reef at two different snorkel and dive sites on this luxury catamaran cruise from Cairns. Travel in style aboard a comfortable catamaran to a mooring off of Upolu Cay. Take a glass–bottom boat to Upolu Cay, then have time to snorkel or scuba dive. Refuel with a buffet lunch on board the catamaran before heading to your next destination, Upolu Reef, for more water time, including a guided snorkeling tour.
events.name: Great Barrier Reef Luxury Snorkel and Dive Cruise from Cairns

events.description: Observe some of Australia’s most popular native wildlife on this tour from Melbourne to Phillip Island that includes a stop at Maru Koala and Animal Park. Interact with koalas and kangaroos before arriving at Phillip Island, home to sea birds, fur seals and, most famously, penguins. You’ll see the Nobbies to look for seals on the rocky coastline while you wait for sunset, when the little penguins perform the Penguin Parade, their nightly ritual of waddling out of the water and along the beach to their burrows. Upgrade options are available for better views and an enhanced experience.
events.name: Phillip Island Tour from Melbourne

events.description: Soak in 360-degree views as you dine on a delicious buffet lunch or dinner at Sydney Tower Restaurant's revolving restaurant. From your vantage point high above the streets of Sydney, the views change as the restaurant slowly revolves during your meal. Large picture windows frame iconic sights like the Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and, in the distance, the Blue Mountains. The buffet lunch or dinner includes a range of tasty dishes that is sure to please everyone in your party.
events.name: Sydney Tower Restaurant Buffet

events.description: Join a hop-on hop-off sightseeing tour by double-decker bus to discover the highlights of Sydney and Bondi Beach. Enjoy unobstructed views and recorded onboard commentary as you travel between 34 stops, including top destinations like Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Darling Harbour and Bondi Beach. Go in-depth at any given place by simply hopping off the bus to explore. You can experience Sydney and Bondi's most noteworthy attractions at your own pace with your choice of ticket, valid for either 24 or 48 hours.
events.name: Big Bus Sydney and Bondi Hop-on Hop-off Tour

events.description: Go behind the scenes at the Sydney Opera House for a fascinating look at this Sydney icon. Your knowledgeable guide leads you through the World Heritage–listed building on a walking tour, sharing entertaining stories about the revered performance center's history and providing access to off-limits parts of the house. Tours take place every 30 minutes throughout the day, so it’s easy to fit into your sightseeing schedule. Upgrade to top off your experience with a delicious tasting plate at the Opera kitchen or dine at the famous Opera Bar
events.name: Sydney Opera House Official Guided Walking Tour

events.description: Experience the Great Ocean Road’s top attractions on this guided excursion that follows the iconic road in reverse. Embark on your journey and beat the crowds while learning about the region’s scenic landscapes and pretty coastal towns from an informative guide. Visit sites including the 12 Apostles, Loch Ard Gorge, Port Campbell, London Bridge, and Great Otway National Park Rainforest.
events.name: Great Ocean Road Reverse Itinerary Tour

events.description: Cruise through Sydney Harbour in style on board a spacious flagship vessel that departs from Circular Quay and King Street Wharf. Glide by landmarks, including the floodlit Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House, and watch the city change colors with the sunset. Then sit down for a 3-course dinner with an array of international dishes including fresh seafood. Enjoy the views from your table or the viewing deck, and live entertainment on this 2.5-hour dinner cruise.
events.name: Sydney Harbour Dinner Cruise

events.description: Visit Perth’s favorite local getaway destination on a day trip to Rottnest Island, located just offshore in the Indian Ocean. Travel to Rottnest by high-speed ferry from either Perth or Fremantle (your choice), and then embark on a sightseeing tour of the island by coach. While you listen to narration from an informative guide, check out landmarks like the West End and Wadjemup Lighthouse. Then enjoy free time in the afternoon to explore the car-free island at your leisure. You may upgrade when booking to include lunch.
events.name: Rottnest Island Tour from Perth or Fremantle

events.description: Discover the natural delights of Phillip Island with an eco-tour from Melbourne. See the iconic Brighton Beach bathing boxes, visit the beach and take some time to admire these historic landmarks. Visit the Moonlit Sanctuary Conservation Park for an up-close encounter with koalas and other Australian wildlife. Finish the day at a local beach where you can watch hundreds of some of the world's tiniest penguins waddle out of the ocean and across the sand to their burrows.
events.name: Phillip Island Penguin, Brighton Beach, Moonlit Sanctuary from Melbourne

events.description: Explore the Blue Mountains the easy way on an all-inclusive, full-day tour from Sydney. Receive personalized service from your guide on a small-group tour with a maximum of 16 participants. It’s an action-packed trip with spectacular views, railway and cable car rides, a forest walk, wildlife encounters, and more. See much more than you would if touring independently on this thorough tour that appeals to many interests
events.name: All-Inclusive Blue Mountains Tour in a Luxury Mercedes Sprinter

events.description: Journey to the rain forest village of Kuranda via two unique transit options on this memorable full-day tour from Cairns or Port Douglas. Skip the line and enjoy Gold Class service aboard the Kuranda Scenic Railway, winding through lush mountain passes and waterfall gorges along the way. In the opposite direction, glide above the treetops in a gondola and soak up spectacular views of the mountains and coastline on the Skyrail Rainforest Cableway. In Kuranda, enjoy leisure time to explore the heritage markets, learn about aboriginal culture or interact with native wildlife.
events.name: Skip the Line: Kuranda Scenic Railway Gold Class and Skyrail Rainforest Cableway

events.description: Explore the Great Barrier Reef and a lush island rain forest on this full-day catamaran tour to Green Island from Cairns. Create your own perfect day on this protected coral cay with a variety of activities including snorkeling, scuba diving, Seawalking, nature walks and tours on a glass-bottom boat. Upgrade to include a delicious buffet lunch on board the catamaran or a ride in a semi-submarine. It’s a fantastic way to discover the underwater wonders of the world’s most famous reef!
events.name: Green Island Day Trip from Cairns

events.description: Journey to the heart of the Blue Mountains on this full-day tour from Sydney, including hotel pick-up. Kick off your adventure petting a koala or hand feeding a kangaroo at the Featherdale Wildlife Park, then enjoy a dramatic view of the Three Sisters rocks from Echo Point. After lunch (own expense), head to Scenic World to ride the Cableway, Skyway and Railway for unbeatable aerial views of the Jamison Valley and Katoomba Falls. Finish with a leisurely cruise along the Parramatta River to Sydney’s Darling Harbour or Circular Quay.
events.name: Blue Mountains Day Trip from Sydney Including Scenic World

events.description: Explore the lush beauty, amazing wildlife and rich heritage of Tropical North Queensland on this customizable full-day trip to Kuranda from Cairns. Travel to this enchanting rain forest village aboard the historic Kuranda Scenic Railway, and choose from a variety of activities including visits to the Tjupakai Aboriginal Cultural Park and Rainforestation Nature Park. Hang out with koalas and exotic birds, browse local markets and opt to include a delicious buffet lunch. At the end of the day, glide through the treetops back to Cairns on the Skyrail Rainforest Cableway.
events.name: Kuranda Scenic Railway Day Trip from Cairns

events.description: Enjoy an evening of fine dining and spectacular views on a dinner cruise that takes place on the waters of Sydney Harbour. Indulge your tastebuds with a meal that includes six superb courses accompanied by Penfolds gold selection of bin and vintage wines and a full open bar. Listen to live music from the lounge singer and pianist while soaking in iconic sights of Sydney such as the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House. It’s a great way to celebrate a special occasion while in Sydney.
events.name: Sydney Harbour Sky Deck Gold Penfolds Dinner Cruise

events.description: Spend a day exploring Sydney with an expert guide, and take in iconic highlights around the famous harbor-side city on this 9-hour tour. Admire the swoop of Sydney Harbour Bridge and the sails of the Sydney Opera House. Tickle your toes in the sands of Manly Beach, and then head over to Bondi Beach later that day. Take in the sights of downtown Sydney, and wrap up with a scenic drive to The Gap and Watson’s Bay. You can also upgrade to add a lunch cruise on Sydney Harbour if you'd like.
events.name: Sydney Tour with Optional Sydney Harbour Lunch Cruise

events.description: Spend an evening on the Yarra River during this Melbourne dinner cruise. As you admire the twinkling city lights reflecting on the water, enjoy a 4-course gourmet meal inclusive of beverages. This fine dining experience includes beer, wine and spirits, as well as coffee, tea, dessert, port and a cheese plate. Cruise past attractions like Federation Square and the Royal Botanic Gardens while soaking up the elegant and relaxing atmosphere of the boat.
events.name: Spirit of Melbourne Dinner Cruise

events.description: See Tasmania's most wild and wonderful attractions on this 5-day tour that loops around the island, from the waterfall-studded rainforests and sand dunes of the West Coast to the alpine lakes and parks of the East Coast. Trek through the Tarkine Rainforest, explore Cradle Mountain-Lake St. Clair National Park, see Tasmanian devils at the Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary, and swim in the Bay of Fires. Other optional activities include a Gordon River Cruise and viewing of the famous little penguin parade. This budget-friendly tour includes overnight accommodation in a hostel dormitory, breakfast each day, and all transport.
events.name: 5-Day Best of Tasmania Tour from Hobart

events.description: Enjoy an insider’s view of Taronga Zoo, a top attraction located on scenic Sydney Harbour. A zoo keeper gives you exclusive behind-the-scenes access to the animals and other amazing experiences that you won't get with regular admission. This small-group tour has a limit of eight participants, ensuring that you receive a personalized 2-hour experience with ample time to mingle with the kangaroos, take photos with koalas and wombats, and have close encounters with a variety of other Australian wildlife.
events.name: Sydney Taronga Zoo General Entry Ticket and Wild Australia Experience

events.description: Dive into the spectacular underwater realm of the Great Barrier Reef on this full-day snorkel and scuba cruise from Cairns. Travel aboard a luxurious catamaran to three renowned dive sites to swim among coral gardens and tropical marine life. All experience levels are welcome, and guides are on hand to assist with your choice of snorkeling, introductory scuba diving, or certified diving. A buffet lunch plus morning and afternoon tea on the catamaran are included.
events.name: Silverswift Outer Great Barrier Reef Dive and Snorkel Cruise from Cairns

events.description: Discover some of Australia’s most photographed landscapes on this full-day tour of the famous Great Ocean Road from Melbourne. Stop for morning tea in Anglesea, spot wild koalas along the way, and tuck into lunch overlooking the dramatic Apollo Bay. After lunch, enjoy a hike through Great Otway National Park, learn how the notorious Shipwreck Coast earned its name, and marvel over natural landmarks like the 12 Apostles, Loch Ard Gorge, and the Gibson Steps.
events.name: Great Ocean Road and 12 Apostles Day Trip from Melbourne

events.description: Set out on a half-day catamaran tour to stunning Whitehaven Beach for swimming at this postcard–perfect slice of paradise. Considered one of the world's top beaches and the most beautiful one in the Whitsunday Islands, Whitehaven Beach is a must-see in the Great Barrier Reef region. Travel in comfort from Port Airlie on a motorized catamaran with air-conditioning. Morning or afternoon tea is provided on board and your crew supplies beach activities and informative commentary along the way.
events.name: Whitehaven Beach Half-Day Cruises

events.description: Experience the delights of Victoria’s wine country on this Yarra Valley wine tour from Melbourne. With an informative wine guide, you’ll visit four popular wineries: Balgownie Estate, Steels Gate Winery, Domaine Chandon and Yering Farm. Enjoy plenty of tastings as well as a winery lunch while you learn about winemaking in Australian and admire the picturesque landscapes.
events.name: Yarra Valley Wine and Winery Tour from Melbourne

events.description: The otherworldly landscapes of the Pinnacles Desert are one of Western Australia’s most impressive natural wonders, found just north of Perth in the Nambung National Park. On this tour, admire the Pinnacles at their most magical during a sunset visit, enjoy a candle-lit dinner in the desert, and stay after-dark for a thrilling stargazing experience. Along the way, stop to try sandboarding at the famous Lancelin Sand Dunes, sample wines and chocolates along the coast, and admire the views along the Indian Ocean Drive.
events.name: Pinnacles Sunset Stargazing Tour

events.description: Embark on a full-day adventure through the forests, mountains, and vineyards of Victoria. Enjoy tea and birdwatching in the Dandenong Ranges, and cruise through a verdant landscape aboard the historic Puffing Billy steam train. Discover the vineyards of the Yarra Valley as you sample premium regional wines at cellar-door tastings. Plus, upgrade to include a gourmet lunch with wine pairings.
events.name: Yarra Valley Wineries and Puffing Billy Steam Train Tour from Melbourne

events.description: Take in panoramic views of lovely Sydney on a Sydney Harbour sightseeing cruise that lasts up to two hours. Choose from two options a morning or afternoon tour that takes you close to the majestic Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Fort Denison and other top sights. Listen to live commentary as you snack on tea, coffee and snacks and light refreshments during the 2-hour tour that includes all of the above plus sparkling wine, cakes and cheeses, with stories focused on Sydney's fascinating heritage.
events.name: Sydney Harbour Coffee Cruise

events.description: Enjoy a full-day tour from Sydney to the Blue Mountains to discover the charms of this UNESCO World Heritage-listed region. Enjoy sweeping views of the Blue Mountains from Kings Tableland or Evans Lookout. Take a walk at Wentworth Falls; visit Leura and Katoomba; stop to see the Three Sisters rock formation and explore the rides at Scenic World (own expense). See ancient Aboriginal rock carvings, then take a boat cruise down the Parramatta River to Circular Quay in Sydney Harbour.
events.name: Blue Mountains Day Trip Including Parramatta River Cruise

events.description: From the Great Barrier Reef to the Daintree Rainforest, experience the best of tropical north Queensland on this Cairns Super Saver that combines three bestselling tours at one discounted price. Over three days, enjoy a snorkeling and scuba diving cruise on the barrier reef; ride the Kuranda Scenic Railway to admire views of the lush rainforest environment; and take a day trip to Cape Tribulation to see koalas and kangaroos at Wildlife Habitat and enjoy a boat ride on the Daintree River.
events.name: Cairns Super Saver: Great Barrier Reef Cruise plus Kuranda Scenic Railway plus Cape Tribulation Day Trip

events.description: Watch the Phillip Island Penguin Parade on this evening tour from Melbourne. See the nightly ritual of these beloved fairy penguins waddling from the ocean to their burrows in the sand. Phillip Island is home to one of the world’s largest colonies of some of the world’s smallest penguins. When booking, select the standard viewing option or the Penguin Plus Viewing Platform for a better vantage point.
events.name: Phillip Island Penguin Parade Evening Tour

events.description: Ensure a memorable experience on the Outer Great Barrier Reef on this full-day, all-inclusive cruise aboard a catamaran. Head for Michaelmas Cay and Hastings Outer Reef and plunge into the underwater world of the Great Barrier Reef by snorkeling amongst its rich marine life. If you have selected the option, you can also include an introductory or certified dive. Includes morning and afternoon tea, as well as a buffet lunch.
events.name: Seastar Luxury Outer Great Barrier Reef Island and Reef Tour from Cairns

events.description: Take a leisurely river cruise from Brisbane to the Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary to meet native Australian wildlife up close. This half-day tour departs from bustling Southbank and cruises along the Brisbane River with views of iconic landmarks on the way to Lone Pine. Upon arrival, enjoy ample time to meet the animals. Observe the platypus, and watch animal shows that feature sheepdogs and birds of prey. A great experience for animal lovers.
events.name: Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary Admission with Brisbane River Cruise

events.description: Customize your visit to the Great Barrier Reef from Cairns with your selection from three travel options with a choice of snorkeling, scuba diving and a one-way or round-trip scenic helicopter tour. Admire views of the Great Barrier Reef from your helicopter as you get a multi-angled perspective on one of the world’s top natural wonders. Then enjoy a close experience of the coral reef by choosing to snorkel or enroll in an optional scuba diving course (additional expense).
events.name: Great Barrier Reef Scenic Helicopter Tour and Cruise from Cairns

events.description: Named K’Gari (paradise) by the local Aborigines, Fraser Island features more than 100 freshwater lakes, extensive rainforest and giant sand dunes. Explore the island with an expert guide who leads rainforest walks at Pile Valley, Central Station, Wanggoolba Creek and the Hammerstone Sandblow, and provides swimming opportunities at Eli Creek, Lake McKenzie, the Champagne Pools and Lake Wabby. Stay overnight at a lodge on Seventy-Five Mile Beach, see the Pinnacles and Maheno shipwreck, and have the option to book a scenic sightseeing flight on this fun and informative 2-day tour.
events.name: 2-Day Fraser Island Tour from Hervey Bay or Rainbow Beach

events.description: Take in panoramic views of top Sydney landmarks as you cruise through Sydney Harbour en route to Taronga Zoo. Your package includes round-trip cruise from Circular Quay to the zoo, and a ride on the Sky Safari Gondola, which whisks you uphill from the boat dock to the main entrance of Taronga Zoo. From the gondola, get an early peek at some of the zoo's inhabitants, such as giraffes, big apes, and native animals like kangaroos and koalas.
events.name: Sydney Harbour Ferry with Taronga Zoo Entry Ticket

events.description: Leave busy Brisbane for a full-day tour that showcases the natural beauty of North Stradbroke Island. Swim in the surf or freshwater lakes, take a short guided hike, view whales and other marine animals from the beach and coastal lookouts, visit small towns including historic Dunwich and Amity, and go in search of the island’s population of wild kangaroos and koalas. Your small-group tour has numbers limited to 21 people, which ensures a more personalized experience with your knowledgeable guide.
events.name: Stradbroke Island Day Trip from Brisbane

events.description: Discover the diverse wildlife of South East Queensland when you travel to the Springbrook plateau, Numinbah Valley and Mt Tamborine on a full-day tour from Brisbane. Your guide leads a leisurely walk in Springbrook National Park to see two stunning waterfalls, Natural Bridge and a glow worm cave. Have time to relax and enjoy the waterfalls and rainforest on this small-group tour with numbers limited to 21 participants, ensuring a more personalized experience.
events.name: Springbrook and Tamborine Rainforest Tour Including Natural Bridge and Glow Worm Cave

events.description: Discover the gourmet delights of Bruny Island during an all-inclusive tour full-day food tour with a knowledgeable guide who takes you to meet seven local producers. You can expect enough food and drink to satisfy a hearty appetite, enjoying seven courses that include oysters, award winning cheeses, berries (in season), local honey, wine, whiskey and chocolates, along with a delicious winery lunch. Soak in the island’s breathtaking scenery during visits to the Bruny Island Neck, historic Two Tree Point in Adventure Bay, white-sand beaches and nature reserves where rare white wallabies live.
events.name: Bruny Island All Inclusive 7-Course Gourmet Day Trip from Hobart

events.description: All aboard for a thrilling half-day mountain adventure on the historic Puffing Billy steam train! Ride the authentic heritage railway through beautiful rainforest valleys and fern gullies as you cross the Blue Dandenong Ranges from Belgrave to Menzies. Stop for a typical Aussie morning tea of Bush Billy Tea and lamingtons, then pay a visit to the crafts village of Sassafras. Or why not make a day of it and upgrade to include a Melbourne City Tour or an evening tour to see the Penguin Parade on Phillip Island?
events.name: Puffing Billy Train With Optional Penguin Parade or Melbourne City Tour

events.description: Enjoy sweeping views of Sydney Harbour and beyond during a scenic helicopter flight over Sydney. Take to the skies for a quick flight that provides stunning panoramic views of Sydney’s eastern coastline including Coogee Beach, Bondi Beach, Manly Cove, Sydney’s spectacular Harbor and city skyline, the Sydney Harbour Bridge, and Sydney Opera House. Learn about the city’s history from your knowledgeable pilot as you fly along the coast of the Pacific Ocean before your pilot whirs over Sydney Head marking the harbor’s entrance. Your Sydney helicopter tour includes hotel pickup and drop-off from central Sydney.
events.name: Sydney Harbour Tour by Helicopter

events.description: Take in the scenery of the Great Ocean Road without the hassle of driving and navigation on this small-group tour from Melbourne. With just 11 travelers in the group, you'll be treated to extra attention from the guide and an intimate group atmosphere. Your small tour bus can stop at some of the off-the-beaten-path spots that mega tour buses can't access, giving you more views and experiences. Stops include the Gibson Steps, the Twelve Apostles, Teddys Lookout, a guided rainforest walk, and others, all accompanied by insightful guided commentary.
events.name: Great Ocean Road Small Group Tour

events.description: <div data-content-target="productText" data-alt-content-url="/orion/tours/2536P4/extra-content" data-altjs>
events.name: My Way - All inclusive New Year's Eve Cruise

events.description: Take a day trip to Rottnest Island, a popular Perth getaway due to its white-sand beaches, secluded bays, scenic bike paths and vehicle-free atmosphere. Travel to the island, just off the coast, by high-speed ferry, and then explore at your leisure with included bike rental. Some options are snorkeling or following the trails to West End, Wadjemup or Bathurst Longhouses, the pink salt lakes or include lunch at Karma Rottnest. When booking, select the option that corresponds to your departure location—either Perth or Fremantle.
events.name: Rottnest Island with Bike Hire from Perth or Fremantle

events.description: Visit some of the top attractions outside of Hobart on this day trip to Mount Wellington, Mount Field National Park, Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary, and the historical town of Richmond. Entry fees are included for a hassle-free experience.
events.name: Mt. Field, Mt. Wellington, Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary and Richmond Day Tour

events.description: Experience the wildlife, mountains, sea and rainforest that define the Wet Tropics of Queensland on this diverse full-day tour from Cairns or Port Douglas. Hand-feed kangaroos and observe other native creatures at Wildlife Habitat Port Douglas, and explore the World Heritage-listed biodiversity of Daintree National Park. Take a guided nature walk through the rain forest of Mossman Gorge, savor a delicious lunch at Cape Tribulation, swim in the Coral Sea and cruise down the beautiful Daintree River.
events.name: Daintree Rainforest, Cape Tribulation and Rainforest Habitat Wildlife Sanctuary Day Tour

events.description: Explore the natural wonders of the Great Barrier Reef on a full-day tour to Fitzroy Island. After arriving from Cairns on a fast ferry, have free time to do what you choose: snorkel on the Great Barrier Reef, lounge on the white-sand beach or see the coral from a glass-bottom boat. Upgrade to add the Activity Pass, which provides a picnic lunch, snorkeling gear, stinger suit, a glass-bottom boat tour, the use of stand-up paddle boards, paddle skis and a floating trampoline.
events.name: Fitzroy Island Day Trip from Cairns

events.description: Enjoy a deluxe sunset cruise on Sydney Harbour accompanied by a delicious two-course dinner with unlimited beer, wine and soft drinks. From the water, admire iconic sights such as Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Fort Denison, Luna Park and more. Snap photos as the sky shimmers at sunset and the city skyline lights up for the night as you cruise through Sydney in the evening.
events.name: Sydney Harbour Sunset Dinner Cruise

events.description: Indulge your inner foodie as you discover the fine wines and culinary delights of Australia’s famous Hunter Valley. Set out from Sydney on a full-day small-group tour, stopping to enjoy tours and tastings at three of the region’s most prestigious boutique wineries.
